A conversation subspace is a set of utterances that address a specific agenda during the conversation, like an itinerary of sorts. It is signified with the help of signals and dimensions. Signals are generic intents that encompass utterance groups. Dimensions are broad sets of coarse-grained agent-customer conversation intents that fulfil a major criterion of a sales call such as Introduction, Lead Qualification, Solutioning etc. Identifying and learning to model the sequence of subspaces (or dimensions and signals) that a conversation proceeds in, can set a guideline to streamline a sales call. This conversation modelling can be used to ingest successful sales calls from agents (and unsuccessful ones) to analyze the factors that lead-up to a successful conversion.

The sales forecast software then matches the algorithm with the trend of sales to each product and creates a sales forecast for the upcoming desired sales period. Managers can customize dashboards using custom Date range filter, Sort by and filter options.

Reports section in the agent dashboard helps the agent/sales rep to view the activity logs, verify the signal signal analysis, review their productivity and get a comparative analysis based on script analysis or selling best practices.
The agent/sales rep can customize the dashboard using a custom date range filter.
Import User (if the dialer is having this capability and it is in our use case)

Auto - Call pull from Dialer on the basis of defined schedular time-- PASS
Task count must be in sync with Dialer--  PASS
Task Details like - leg1 and leg2 numbers, leg1 and leg2 call status, handling time, talk duration, Audio URL, Date- time, caller ID, and country code --PASS
Proper Transcription (dual channel) as per audio recording--FAIL
Signal Detection as per the defined playbook-- FAIL
RTC on Sales Rep Portal and Web Extension - BLOCKED
Cues must pop up as per keywords – BLOCKED
Cues Pop-up time must be in sync like 1 sec – BLOCKED
Cues must come as per the sales rep’s Product and playbook – BLOCKED

All calls for 1 week for 5 leads
Speaker identification - right speaker associated with right snippet
Check if right language has been input for ASR ( EN-US )
Find words missed. For example, if 10 words were missed in 100, false negative rate is 10%
Find words wrongly transcribed : For example if 3 words were wrongly transcribed out of 100, Word error rate is 3%

-Pick all sub signals for script intelligence dimension
--Test for false positives - signals present but wrongly detected
Check all signals for 5 calls with duration >1 mins
-Test for false negatives - signals which should have been present but were missed by data science model
Check for 2 dimensions for 2 days of call data if % is correct
Check for 5 calls if call summary is coming accurately
Manually test all cues on post integrated system

A Sales conversation is segregated into different dimensions, these are basically essential aspects that are covered in a sales call by the agent. Each dimension consists of a set of signals and sub signals that are measured to evaluate the effectiveness of each dimension from a sales call.

Script Intelligence is a platform where the agent can evaluate the total effectiveness of the sales calls and activities that have been done. The agent can examine the success at each stage of  dimension on this page.In order to determine where the agents are falling short and where they have excelled, Script Intelligence analyses the conversations the agent has had in relation to the dimensions and rates according to the number of signals and sub signals covered within it. It provides a pitch score for each conversation done by the sales Reps.
Pitch Score: Determines how effective an agent has pitched the product to the customer.

Dimensions: Are the essential aspects that are covered by the sales rep/agent during the sales conversation with the prospective customer. It gives the agent a definite path to follow that establishes a successful strategy for approaching the client or customer to execute a product pitch.
Semantic/Script Intelligence: This segment deals with the external dynamics of the call. It guides the agent with an approach for effectively pitching a product. It consists of dimensions such as,
Selling Best Practices: This segment deals with the selling aspects of the call. In this the soft skills of the agents are measured using dimensions.  This consists of dimensions such as,
Each Dimension contains a set of Signals and Sub Signals that are captured when the customer and agent uses them in the sales calls.
Each Dimension is measured by the Signal wise coverage for leads (Win Vs Lost)
Signals: These are the indications that are defined under a particular dimension that get captured when the customer or sales rep initiates during the conversation.
Sub Signals: These are variations of a signal or subsets of signals that have a similar context to that of a signal.
For Example: Price related(Signal) ⇒ Its is very expensive, Price is too high (Sub Signals)
Greetings (Signal) ⇒ Good evening, Good Morning(Sub Signals)
Opening: How effectively a sales rep Initiates the conversations.
For example: Hi, good morning, what is your name?...
Lead Qualification: How extensive are your reps/agents on asking qualifiable questions to identify the right prospects.
For Example: If an agent is trying to sell a Laptop, he needs to make sure he is calling students or people in need of a laptop. (prospective buyer.
Needs Discovery: Indicates if your sales reps are able to uncover the lead pain points or needs of the prospect.
Key Value Proposition: How well the Sales Reps are able to highlight the key selling aspects of the products to your leads.
Product Knowledge: Indicates if your Sales Reps are able to explain the products thoroughly in order to keep the customer interested.
Price Discussion: Shows how successful are the Sales Reps on navigating the product pricing discussion
Closing: Shows if a rep is able to end the conversation effectively with concrete follow ups
Consultative Selling: Understands your leads by asking in-depth questions.
Empathy: shows how well the agents empathise with the leads in conversations.
Listening Skills: Indicates if the agent is practising active listening with the customer.
Confidence: Indicates on how confident the agent is during their conversations.
Urgency Creation: Indicates how well the agent conveys urgency in conversation with the leads.
Positive Energy: Indicates the level of positive energy during the call or conversations.
Rapport Building: Indicates how well the agent builds connection with the lead on a personal level.
Politeness: Shows how polite the agent is during their conversations with the leads.
The Intelligence page showcases the performance with a structured template that consists of,
Playbook Coverage: Shows the signal wise coverage of all leads [Won Vs Lost], can switch the “All Leads” toggle button to display coverage of all leads.
Playbook Intensity: Shows the coverage of time spent across all Dimensions for all leads.
Leaderboard : Shows the performance of the sales Reps.
Top Scoring Calls :  Ranks the Calls based on the pitch score.
Clicking on “More” Hyperlink opens up a tab that gives the detailed overview of the call with a transcript section.
Key Highlights: Provides Information Highlights on each Dimension.

The page provides the agent to look through the overview of all the dimensions  as well as overview on each dimension for all leads. The agents can see if they have missed any stage (gaps) and try to improvise on their upcoming conversations with the leads. The agent can set the dashboard date range and filter the dashboard based on the defined pipeline and its stages. It helps the agents to analyse their performance at each dimension and improve their effectiveness during calls and get better results.
Steps to go to Intelligence page on Salesken agent dashboard:
Login to the Agent/Sales Rep account using salesken agent credentials.
Users will directly land onto the Home page of Agent dashboard.
Go to the configuration menu on the top left corner of the dashboard.
Navigate to “Intelligence” and click on the drop down
Click on “Script Intelligence / Selling Best practices”

Signal Analysis is a page that provides sales managers with overall signals that are captured during the Sales rep - Lead conversations. It shows the graphical representation of each dimension w.r.t signal-wise coverage for all leads. Sales managers can provide the reps with powerful insights on how to approach the leads, and design the approach with the latest trends so that they can get better results. Sales Managers can download Signal Analysis reports with the download option on the page, and they can set the date range with a custom date range filter.
The Funnel button on the top right corner of the page allows the manager to filter out the Signals based on multiple requirements.
Sales Reps, Pipeline, Stage, Teams, and Lead Status.
Signals: These are the indications that are defined under a particular dimension that gets captured when the customer or sales rep initiates during the conversation.
Objective: To analyse the signals that are caught/captured during the conversation between the Sales rep and the Lead w.r.t their dimension under which signals are defined.

Dimensions: These are the essential aspects that are covered by the sales rep/agent during the sales conversation with the prospective customer. It gives the agent a definite path to follow that establishes a successful strategy for approaching the client or customer to execute a product pitch. These are further divided into Signals and Sub Signals. Signals and Sub Signals specific to each Dimension are used to measure it.
By clicking on each dimension over the bar graph, it splits the bar graph into signal-wise coverage for that dimension. (As shown in the image below)
Lead Qualification: How extensive are your reps/agents in asking qualifiable questions to identify the right prospects.
For Example: If an agent is trying to sell a Laptop, he needs to make sure he is calling students or people in need of a laptop. (prospective buyer)
Closing: Shows if a rep is able to end the conversation effectively with concrete follow-ups

There is a data table given under the bar graphs that consists of information about each dimension. It shows the data regarding the number of conversations, Progress, and Coverage of signals caught in dimensions for all leads.
By clicking on the plus sign near the dimension it shows you the signal-wise coverage under that dimension. (As shown in the image above)
Assertiveness: Indicates on how assertive the agent is during their conversations.
Satisfaction: Indicates the satisfaction level of the Lead during their conversations.
Joy: Indicates if the Lead is excited during the conversation.
Compassion: Indicates the level of compassion between the sales rep and lead.
Curiosity: Indicates if the sales rep is able to generate curiosity in the lead.
Frustration: Indicates if the lead is frustrated during the conversation.
Worry: Indicates if the lead is worried about something during the conversation.
Consultative Selling: Understand your leads by asking in-depth questions.
Listening Skills: Indicates if the agent is practicing active listening with the customer.
Rapport Building: Indicates how well the agent builds a connection with the lead on a personal level.

For each segment, there is a data table given under the bar graphs that consists of information about each dimension. It shows the data regarding the Number of Leads, Progress, and Coverage of signals caught in dimensions for all leads.
By clicking on the plus sign near the dimension it shows you the signal-wise coverage under that dimension.
Steps to go to Signal Analysis page in Sales Manager Dashboard:
Login to your Salesken Sales Manager Portal with the appropriate credentials.
Users will land on the Sales Manager Dashboard.
Navigate towards the configuration in the top left corner and click on the “Reports” drop-down arrow.
Click on “Signal Analysis”, User will be directed to the Signal Analysis page of the Sales Manager Dashboard.

This page gives sales managers insights on customer objections that are raised during the conversation between agent and customer. The sales manager has the ability to view the objections raised by leads and suggests to the sales reps on how they can minimize objections during the conversations.

Conversations are determined by the number of unique conversations where a particular objection has occurred.

FrontSpin is a dialer where reps can make or receive calls and FrontSpin stores all the call details made from its platform. Integration with Dialer allows you to connect all your call information to Salesken.
Integrate FrontSpin with Salesken to capture and analyze sales conversations. Collect all of your call recordings in Salesken to obtain transcripts and insights from every customer interaction.

Salesken helps you with what your reps are doing differently over the phone: what questions they're asking, how they’re discussing, what their talk ratio is, where your competitor was mentioned, or make sure your reps are following the deals winning sales script. And help you solve the conversational challenges and win the deals with insights into these conversations in real-time and post-call.

Easily share sales calls with customers or internally. Ask for feedback, tag team members to get them involved, and pinpoint areas for improvement. Encourage team collaboration and help reps win more deals together.

Let’s have a look at what you need to have for successful integration.
Salesken’s admin credentials (integrations page can be accessed only from the admin portal)
Zoom admin credentials (to access all the meetings recording for PCA)
Personal calendar credentials (to fetch real-time stream of live meetings)
Download Salesken app from Zoom marketplace (to show real-time cues)
Steps on How to integrate MS Teams with Salesken:
Click on the hamburger icon on the top left of your screen and select “Integrations”
Here you can see a list of tools that you can integrate with Salesken. Now click on the ‘Connect’ button on “Microsoft Teams” card.
You’ll be redirected to the MS Teams Sign-in Page to authenticate.
Enter your credentials and sign-in to your Microsoft Teams account.
After signing in Microsoft verifies the user by sending a code to the registered Mobile Number of the User.
Enter the Code and Click on “Verify” button.
“Permissions Requested” pop up appears from Microsoft
Scroll down and Click on “Accept” button to proceed.
Once you’re successfully integrated, you will be redirected back to Salesken’s web application
Integration to fetch real-time call recordings via Salesken bot

Once you’ve integrated MS Teams with Salesken, the user needs to integrate their google/Microsoft calendar with Salesken in order to fetch recordings of that particular user and map those meetings to respective users.

Please check out this document to understand how to integrate your google/Microsoft calendar with Salesken, successfully when the meeting is scheduled, a meeting follow-up card will be created on the agent dashboard.
Every sales rep in the organization has to integrate their calendar with their salesken accounts.
Please note that only the respective users can undo the integration and the admin can’t undo this user-level integration
What is a Salesken bot and why is it important?

Salesken bot is an automated bot that will join in all the meetings and has the capability to interact and access the MS Teams meetings while the meetings are happening in real-time. The bot can also send this live stream to Salesken to analyze the calls and show cues in real-time.
Salesken also provides you the feature to get Real Time Cues during your MS Teams meetings.
Integration for real-time cueing via Salesken MS Teams app
Only via Salesken’s MS Teams app and with the help of Salesken bot Real-time cueing is possible.
To enable that you need to follow the following steps:
MS Teams must be integrated with Salesken (steps mentioned above)
After the integration, go to MS Teams App on your system.
(Please ensure you are logged in with the same account present on Salesken)
You’ll see an option called ‘Apps’ on the top menu, click on ‘Apps’ and search for ‘Salesken’ in the discovery option and add the Salesken App to your MS Teams account.

Once the Salesken app has been added in the MS Teams application, a Salesken Bot will be joining as a participant in every scheduled meeting from your calendar to get the real-time stream of the ongoing meeting
Real-time cues will be displayed for every meeting in the Salesken app on MS Teams
Calls have to be either recorded by the sales associates or let the ‘Salesken bot’ record the meetings
Right after you integrate MS Teams, Salesken will analyze the recordings of the calls made after Integration only.

Salesken doesn’t analyze internal MS Teams meetings, for example, if your company email address ends with ‘@salesken.ai’ then we won’t fetch the data for the meetings where all the guests have the email id ending with ‘@salesken.ai’
We have to schedule and share meetings through the calendar only. An external participant is required to join BOT and live streaming for real-time cues.
Sharing meeting links directly or instant meetings will not invite BOT.

Personal Information: Agent can update his personal details in this section.

Profile Overview: This gives an overview on all the tasks done by the agent. Tasks are recorded in an orderly manner from recent to past. It consists of a notification modal that provides the latest updates or activities done.

Inbound Settings: Agent can configure the inbound calls that can be either received on the desktop or by mobile. If mobile not answered then it goes to voicemail.
Bot Settings: Agent can update bot info, Name and upload Image.
Calendar: Agents can connect to Google Calendar for scheduling and time management of their work.
Email: Agents can integrate Google Email services on the profile, it helps to send and receive mails over internet.

Hello? Hi, is this Daniel? Yes this is Daniel. Good morning Daniel, I’m Hailey calling from Uplift Movers to help with your request for a quote. ?Yes and thanks for getting back to me. I’m helping my parents move from Saint Louis to Chicago in two weeks. What kind of information do you need for a quote, or what is the process? Happy to give you an overview.  we’ll verify availability for your move date, which I see you listed as March 10th from Saint Louis to Chicago.I just need some basic information about your items and the space. Then if you want to proceed based on that estimate, we would schedule a visit to the property for a survey of the items to get a final quote. OK I understand. How long does it take to schedule the visit? I’m a bit worried about running out of time given this is just two weeks away. Yes, it’s coming right up! I’ll make sure that scheduling page is included in the email with your estimate.  Great, okay. I’ll be sure to book the visit right away. So what else do we need in order to get the estimate? I just need a few details about the space and the items we’re moving. How big is your parent’s home in square footage? That’s a good question… I would say it’s about 2,500 square feet How many bedrooms? Three Yes there is a garage, two cars, yes there is a finished basement. No attic. Any special or large appliances like gym equipment or a freezer box, pool table, etc There is a pool table but that’s being moved separately I believe. Okay. Any other heavy or unusual items beyond furniture? I don’t think so. Alright Daniel, that is all I need to get an estimate ready for you. I’ll go put these details into the computer and have that email to you in the next 15 or 20 minutes. That sounds good, I really appreciate it. My pleasure to help. What questions do you have for me at this point I’m just curious, what is the price based on? Or how is the estimate calculated? Yes, it’s basically a formula based on weight of the items,  and the related labor costs which are hourly for packing and moving. Right, okay. Last question: Is the service insured? Or what if anything gets damaged or lost in the move? You’re very welcome. I’ll follow up with you soon. OK great. Take care. You too. Goodbye.

SalesHive - Initiating calls and Real Time cues for Agents
Go to Organization Settings of SalesHive on Super Admin,
Go to → Telephony → Dialer → Select the option as Phone Burner.
How to configure SalesKen Web Extension to get Real Time Cues: -
Click on Extensions, the user will be redirected to the Extensions page
Select the Main menu button from the extensions Page

Step 4: In the Search bar search for “SalesKen”, Select the result that appeared and click on Add to Chrome button > Click on Add Extension button and the SalesKen web extension will be successfully installed.
Step 5:  Click on the “Extensions” button present on the top right of the browser and select the installed salesken chrome extension. You can also pin the extension for ease of access.
Step 6: Log in to the web extension using valid credentials (The web Extension will be displayed on the page)
Step 7: Open the SalesHive on your Chrome browser - ​https://app.saleshive.com/  and login to SalesHive by entering the appropriate credentials.
Step 8: In order to place a call through SalesHive, Click on the “Call” button (Symbol) beside the Lead name to initiate or place a call.
SalesHive also allows the user to select multiple leads and make calls. This is done by selecting the Checkboxes of the listed leads. (As shown in the image below)
Click on “Start Dial Session” button on top right corner to place/initiate the calls to the selected leads.
Step 9: Once the “Call” button has been clicked “Phone number” Modal appears,
Select “All” or Select a specific device for which the number is assigned and click on the “Call” Button (Symbol) to place a call.
Step 10: The user will be redirected to Phone Burner page (for calls) where the dial session settings modal appears.
Note: Phone Burner is integrated with SalesHive in order to conduct dial sessions for its users.
Step 11: On the PhoneBurner’s connect to dial session screen, Select the browser as the method for placing the call. Once prompted grant the Microphone access as requested.
Step 12: Click on the “Start Dialling“ button as requested by Phoneburner to place the call.

Step 13: Once the dial session has started. Please make sure you have activated the tab for streaming. If the tab has not been activated for the stream, you will receive a message to activate the stream.
Right-click anywhere on the page, and choose Salesken > Initiate Call
Use a keyboard shortcut for Windows(alt + shift + s) and Mac (option + shift + s)
Step 14: You can see the real-time cues on the ongoing call in the Salesken web extension.
Step 15: For Call Disposition (Ending the call)
Click on the “Live Answer” Button on the bottom of the page
Click on “End Call” to disconnect the ongoing call.
The page prompts the user to select the type of disposition,
For Example: (They are interested, Not yet interested, wrong person, Do not call)
Step 16: Click on “End Dial Session” button to complete the session
Make sure you are logged in correctly to the Salesken chrome extension and the dialer using the same email.
Ensure you logout and login at the start of the shift from the chrome extension
Salesken chrome extension is updated with the latest version.
Pin the Salesken chrome extension for further ease of access.
The user needs to be logged in with their work/salesken profile within Chrome
Don’t forget to mark the chrome browser tab active from which the call is being placed.
Use the Salesken chrome extension from the same chrome window from which calls are being placed
Cuemath - Extension calling with Leadsquared from chrome store

Step 4: In the Search bar search for “SalesKen Lite”, Select the SalesKen Lite from the result that appeared and click on Add to Chrome button > Click on Add Extension button and the SalesKen web extension will be successfully installed.
Step 5:  Click on the Extensions button present on the top right of the browser and select the installed Salesken Lite web extension.
Step 7: Open LeadSquared - https://login.leadsquared.com/ and login to LeadSquared.

Step 8:  Once you have logged in to the extension and leadsquared you will see a call icon in front of the lead number to place calls. Once logged in to the extension you don’t need to log in again until you have signed out. The call icon will be only visible if you are logged in to the chrome extension

Step 9: Click on the ‘Call’ symbol to make a call to the contact from the leadsquared. As shown in below screenshot the extension will open and the call will be placed to the contact and the conversation will be happening directly via your browser with the customer. Allow the microphone permissions as requested.
Step 10:   When the call is in progress,

GDPR settings - You can control the recording of the call based on the GDPR settings has been set for the organization and you can choose to enable or disable the recording for the call from the toggle on record.
Mute or Un-Mute call - From the Microphone(MIC) button you can Mute or Un-Mute the call.
Call Disconnect - To end the call click on the call disconnect icon.

Step 11:  Disposition & Follow-Up - Once the call has been disconnected proceed to dispose of the call and set the follow-up. Select the appropriate disposition from the drop-down and other requested details. If you have missed disposing of the call, you can not go back and dispose of the call will be marked as not disposed.
Click on the call icon from the leads page as mentioned in step 9 to make more calls
The call can be placed from the lead details page as well
The call can be placed to both primary and secondary numbers.
If the call is already in-progress you can not place a new call until the previous call has been disconnected.
The call will get disconnected if the browser page has been refreshed or re-loaded.
You would not have to re-login to the extension every day to place the calls.

The playbook is a feature that provides managers with a pie chart that displays the overall dimensions and signals covered by the sales reps with their leads within the organisation. This feature allows to view how well the sales reps are covering the dimensions and its pre-defined signals while engaging with the leads in their conversations.
The admin can sort the page by using a “Sort By” option in the top right corner.
It allows the admin to sort the page on the basis of,
Click the “Menu” button and select the “Playbooks” option.
Click on the “Create Playbook” button in the top right corner.
Choose the image location and select the desired image then click the “Open” button.
Your image will now be uploaded to your playbook.
Enter the Name of the playbook in the Name field.
Once all the requirements for the playbook have been updated
Playbook card provides the Admin with the details that are configured within it.
The Admin can edit, delete and configure the playbook and cues associated with it, by clicking on the actions button on the top right corner of each Playbook Card.
Click on the actions button on the top right corner of the Playbook Card
Admin can edit the playbook name on the Name field.
Clicking on “Update Playbook” updates the changes made.
This is a page that provides a platform for the admin to create and configure cues on specific playbooks.
Admin can sort this page by using the Sort by dropdown. Playbooks can be sorted based on,
Click on the “Create Cue Card” Button in the top right corner.
Name → Enter the name of the Cue Card
Content → Jog down the content that needs to be shown in the cue card.
Type → Select the type or purpose of the cue card.
Trigger words → Enter the keywords through which this cue card needs to be triggered.
Click on the “Submit” button after filling up all the fields.

You will need to log into your account to update your profile information. The personal information contains details about the user like name, contact number, and email address with the user’s profile picture.
Your image will now be uploaded to your profile.
Login to your Salesken account. Click on the user profile picture or name on the top-right of the Dashboard.
Click “My profile option” from the dropdown and navigate to “Personal information”.
Change your name and Click the “Save changes” button.

This page allows the admin to configure the settings for the entire organisation. It helps to manage and authorise organisational information. The admin has control over the functions performed by the Sales Managers and Agents.
There are various fields that the admin can configure on this page,
Primary Mode Of calling: To set single-channel calling or conference as the default calling mode.
Allow Skip Disposition: To make disposing of calls optional for sales reps
PII Redaction: To hide sensitive details like Credit card no. , Pan card no. etc.
Profanity: When enabled or set as true hides abusive language during conversations.
GDPR Settings: Admin authorizes the sales reps to enable/ disable the call recording feature.
Real-time Cues: To Enable/Disable Cueing for the sales reps.
Manager and Associate: To mask customer details on reports.
On view - When masking is enabled, any Manager logged in Salesken portal, will see all fields containing Customer Personal details like phone number, and email id masked in the format ‘xxxx-xxxx-xxxx
On download - When masking is enabled for any manager then he will not be able to see the customer details in downloaded reports.
On view - When masking is enabled, any sales rep logged in Salesken portal will see all fields containing Customer details like phone number, and email id  masked in the format ‘xxxx-xxxx-xxxx
On download - When masking is enabled for any associate then he will not be able to see the customer details in downloaded reports.
Mask Customer details → On View and On Downloads
Enable SMS - To enable sms feature for the sales rep.
Enable Call - To enable the call feature for the sales rep.
Webinar Bot Settings: Admin can add an avatar image and enter the Bot name.
(File size of image → Max 40MB, supports png, jpg & jpeg)
Transcription Settings: Allows to choose language to view transcriptions in translated English(if available) or in the original native language.
Lead Source & CRM Lead Id search on Lead page: To Enable/Disable the search mode for Lead Source and CRM Lead Id on the Leads Page
Motivational Cues Settings: To enable or disable the motivational cues.
Enable Lead Intelligence: To enable the Lead Intelligence feature
Enable Audio Download: To enable audio download in the activity log
Report Settings: Allows admin to configure the operations on reports and calls.
Reports Refresh Timeout (in seconds): To refresh the pages of your report in a time interval.
Duration Reports Intervals: Allows admin to customise intervals on duration reports by setting the time slots.
Admin can set time zone settings on the basis of,
Conversation Metrics By Time Split: To customise duration reports by setting up the duration intervals.
Organisation Timezone: To set a Standard Timezone for the organisation.
Reporting Timezone: Allows admin to set reporting time according to Sales rep or Customer.
Organisation Type: It’s the type of customers being reached out to, B2B or B2C
Clicking on the “Submit” button in the bottom right corner to set the organisation according to the settings configured by the admin.

Templates make it easier for you to respond to frequently asked questions and send out mass texts. When an admin creates a template, sales reps can reuse it, saving time and ensuring efficiency, and giving leads a seamless experience. Customize and save messages you send to the lead. Find out how to create templates for SMS.
Click the “Menu” button and select the “Templates” option.
Click the “Add template” button on the top-right of the templates page.
Enter the template contents such as, Template Name and Template Content.
The created SMS template is displayed in the templates page. Admin can edit it from the template page.
Click the edit icon on the top-right of the template card.
Edit the template contents and click the “Submit” button.
Template Content should contain Maximum Characters of 1600 words.
Admin can only edit the template once it is created.
File upload is the feature that enables the manager to assign files to any users by simply searching the name in the search dropdown and uploading the respective files.
To access the File Upload page, you must have logged in as a manager.
Select Sales  Rep: Select the Sales Rep from the dropdown under whom you want to upload the file.
Drop Files here or click to upload: Here we can upload files in mp3,mp4,wav, and .au format. We can upload a maximum of 40 Mb files.
We can cancel the uploading file in between by clicking the “Cancel Upload” Option.
A file of a maximum size of 40 Mb can be uploaded.

A sales pipeline can assist you in visualizing the sales process. It will show you where all of your deals are in the sales funnel, where deals are stalling, and which sales activities are bringing the revenue most. Breaking the sales process down into small, trackable tasks, adds a layer of accountability and makes goals easier to achieve.

In other words, a pipeline is a sequential series of specialized modules or processes. It is a set of user-defined stages for a specific organization's product. Every sale’s sales rep should adhere to the stages defined in their team's mapped pipeline based on the sales cycle. Pipelines have a few architectural stages, tasks, and leads that can be mapped to pipelines.
Manages your sales pipeline and builds great sales opportunities.

The pipeline is an important aspect of sales, when you think of a sale you need to have a clear vision to close the deal. How the product or service is going to sell or how does it convert a prospect into a customer?
Click the “Menu” button and select the “Pipeline” option.
Go to the “Menu” button and select the “Pipeline” option in the drop-down.
Click the “Create pipeline” option on the top-right side of the screen.
Enter the Pipeline name to be created in the pop-up and click the “Submit” button.
Navigate to the three dots on the right side of the default pipeline
Update Team: Admin can select/update the team in the pipeline list.
Update a Product: Admin can select/update a product and add them into their Pipeline list.
Admin can select the Teams and Products which will be subjected to the specified pipeline.
Add New Stage: Admin can create a new stage for a particular pipeline.
Click on “Add New Stage” (Pop Up appears)
Click on the “Submit” button to add a new stage.
Once all the configurations are done on the “Edit Pipeline” page
Click on “Update” button on the bottom right corner of the page to update the changes made.

An audit log provides an immutable record of how user data is created, modified, and accessed. This is the view of audited information in the user profile and provides more information about each event.
It keeps a record of all the tasks done by the admin regarding managers/sales reps with the timestamp.
It is the trace of changes an admin has made.
The Audit Log displays the activities performed in the user profile of the admin portal.
All the changes are reflected in the audit log. The update gives a quick overview of the changes made to the profile.
Audit Log events are generated by the Salesken system. They are driven by the user action. Sales Rep cannot configure, disable, sort, edit, and delete any information displayed in the audit log.
This section allows the admin to change password while they are logged in.
Click the “User Profile” on the top-right side of the Dashboard page.
In the User Profile section below your profile picture >” My Profile” option.
3. Click the “Change password” tab in the left sidebar of the user profile. (A Pop-Up appears)
4. Click  the “Proceed” option( A Change password Pop-Up appears )
5. Click the “OK” button ( Log out from the page automatically )
Enter the credentials from the e-mail and click the “Log In ” button.
An Email will be sent to the registered Email for changing the password.
Once you reset or change your password, you'll need to re-login into Salesken from all of your devices.
The user profile details is available to the current user of the Admin portal to view and update the profile details post-login.
Click the user profile picture (or username) at the top-right of the dashboard.
In the dropdown, Click the “My Profile” option.

It gives the admin an overview of the activities/tasks  performed by the sales rep with a timestamp in an Activity Log modal.  This section allows admin to get an idea on what has been done, what is pending and reminders. Notifications tab shows all the activities done within the organisation such as, Updates, alerts, Download, SMS etc..
My activity card lets the admin review and manage their sales rep's activities.
It displays task lists, durations, contact numbers, and times of calls placed by sales reps to stay up to date.
You can use My Activities to keep track of all your sales reps-lead conversations.
When You click any particular task activity, admin is redirected to the “conversation page”.
You will receive various kinds of notifications such as:
Inbound call notification: The admin will be notified when any sales rep receives an inbound call on the Salesken provisioned number, before the call lands.
Report download notification: The admin will receive a notification whenever any report download action is initiated by the manager/sales rep and it has been prepared.
Outbound call notification: The admin will be notified when a call is initiated by a sales rep informing that a call has been initiated.
Lead management notification: The admin will be notified when a lead is marked as lost or won by a sales rep.
The admin will be notified of the following:
When the user misses an inbound call and the call goes to voicemail
When weekly or daily signal achievement goal is not met
When a user reported an issue in the system.

Click the “Change password” tab in the left sidebar of the user profile. (A Pop-Up appears)
6. Enter the credentials from the e-mail and click the “LOG IN ” button.

An audit log provides an immutable record of how the data is created, modified and accessed. This is the view of audited information in the user profile and provides more information about each activity.

When a sales associate makes a call to lead, they are often faced with a scenario where they are unable to answer certain queries of the lead, to address that we have a functionality where we show those pre-configured FAQ to the sales associate while on call depending upon what customer has said which can help sales associate to convert that lead to customer or just to help them with their queries.
This functionality is used to track the efficiency of the call made by the sales associate

Consider a scenario where an org wants to sell certain product to all there customer, then a sales associate needs to sell that in each call they make, these kind of things can be tracked by the playbook functionality.

The sales manager can check all of the leads inside the organisation on this page. It gives managers all the details about the prospects to whom the sales representatives have pitched the product. The managers may track each lead on this page and drill down to all the tasks completed over that lead if they need to evaluate a specific lead in particular.

Sales Managers can Add lead, Bulk Add leads, download leads and filter leads by setting specific date ranges. They can search for any lead within the organisation by entering the lead name/email/number/company name on the search bar.
The Funnel button on the top right corner of the page allows the manager to filter out the Leads based on multiple requirements.
Deal Types, Intent, Pipeline, Stage, Team, Sales rep and Decision maker.
On leads page, each lead details will be shown in a block, as shown in the image below,
Clicking on each block gives a detailed view of tasks conducted on that lead with a timestamp.
Conversation Summary is a block that gives a brief of the task created on each call.
It shows the company name with the pipeline and stage.
Sales Cycle: Total time taken between the first conversation and the last conversation with the lead.
Decay: Indicates the time since the last conversation with the lead.
Start date: Date on which the conversation was initiated with the lead
Pitch Score: Provides a quantitative Score on how effective an agent has pitched the product to the customer.
Gaps: Dimensions that are not covered in any of the conversations with the lead.
Tip:  Each lead's block can be clicked on to reveal a detailed view of calls made to that lead by agents/sales representatives.

This page shows the detailed tasks carried out by the sales rep with the lead. It gives data on all calls made by the agent to the lead with the dimensions covered within the conversation, duration, sales rep talk ratio, seller party and buyer party.
By clicking on the “View details” button on the top right corner of the block, it reveals the entire activity log for that call.
Includes transcript, playback audio file, dimensions covered etc..
Steps to Add Lead on the Leads page of Sales Manager Dashboard:
Login to your Salesken Sales Manager Portal with appropriate credentials.
Navigate to the configuration menu on the top left corner and Click on “Leads”
Click on the “Add Lead” button on the top part of the leads page.
Enter the required information on each field about the lead
(when adding, manager needs to assign a sales rep to the lead)
Click on the “Save” button to Add lead onto the dashboard.
To Bulk Add Leads on Sales Manager Dashboard:
Click on the “Bulk Add” button on the top part of the leads page.
Users will land on the “Upload Leads” page.

Any supporting documents for the Bulk Leads can be added by clicking on the “Drop files here or click to upload” section of the page. You can also drag and drop a file from your system into this section.
Once uploaded the manager has Bulk added leads onto the Dashboard.
This page keeps a record of all the conversations made by the sales reps in the organisation.

The Sales Managers can look into any conversation made by the sales reps on this page. All the conversation on this page is displayed with the transcript, playback of the audio file, call summary, and visual appearance of signals caught on each point in the audio file.
The Sales Manager can scout the conversation by entering the Lead name/Lead number/Email/fragments of snippet texts on the search bar area of the page.
They can sort the page based on duration and date using the Sort By drop-down, create a playlist by segregating the conversations based on,

This page provides Agents an overview on the productivity of his overall tasks. This page allows the agents to know their Total Conversation counts, and Total Duration of calls made on day-day basis.  This is shown through graphs on Conversation counts, Conversation Duration and Pitch Score. These graphs can be altered using the filter option on the page.
Sales Reps can download productivity reports within specific dates by using a custom date range filter on the page.
Sales Reps can download the Productivity report by clicking on the download button on the page.
The Funnel button on the top right corner of the page allows the manager to filter out the page based on,
Pipeline, Conversation type, Call type, Stages, and Signals.
Conversation Counts: It displays the total number of calls made by the agent on a day-day basis with a line graph.
Conversation Duration: It displays the Total time spent by the agent on calls on a day-day basis with a line graph.
Pitch Score: It displays the Average Pitch Score percentage of the agent covered on the day-day basis with a line graph.
The Productivity page consists of a data table that shows the date-wise conversations performed by the agents. The table consists of following contents,
This table helps agents to view conversations done on a particular day and access the duration and pitch score.
Sorting: When clicked on the headings the data will be sorted in descending order, when clicked again the data will be sorted in ascending order
Steps to go to Activity Log page of Agent Dashboard:
Click on “Productivity”, User will be directed to the Productivity page of the Agent Dashboard.
Lead Discovery  :  Customer use cases
It means finding  the lead associated with conversation. Leads are generally managed in CRM .  Lead discovery is all about  finding  the associated lead in CRM given a conversation .
Bringing lead related information like deals , status , company information for lead or revenue intelligence.
Pushing conversation data like call summary , recording url or any Salesken calculated fields like call duration , talk ration etc.
If a call  has lead information (lead id) of CRM , it directly fetches other required information using this id.  This is possible only when Dailers give you lead information.
If the call doesn't have lead information , then the lead gets discovered using the phone number or email id of scp .

Finding lead using Phone number or email id  : There is entity mapping configuration in Salesken application for each CRM.  Here , one can specify entity and fields on which searching can be made. Refer ​https://salesken.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SALV2/pages/2137424122 .
Salesken search lead in CRM using phone number or email . In case of single search result , its straight forward
In case multiple leads are found given a phone number or email , we take the latest active leads. Latest active leads defined by last modified time of leads

Leads are managed across the different objects :  For example lead are managed in lead , opportunity and account entity, mostly valid for Salesforce, In this case , we can set priority of finding using Entity mapping.  According to priority it will search. For example if you search the priority1 to Lead and 2 to Account , it will find lead in Lead entity first , if not found then it will go to Account entity and so on.
2. Salesforce [B2B] use case:  Lead getting converted in Opportunity after sometimes (after deal done).  In such case  Salesken will automatically discover Opportunity .
For this ,workflow make sure you have configured the mapping correctly.

Agents can track his/her performance, conduct analysis, and generate reports using the Agent Portal platform. The dashboard gives the agents flexibility to view their reports with a custom date range filter, analyze his conversations made to leads, check productivity and perform comparative analysis reports. It also provides agents an option to make their calls through Salesken smart dialer (Telephony) and make an SMS by creating a template.

The manager can view a list of all the tasks and activities completed within the organisation by using the manager portal. It gives managers a place to research and evaluate the efficiency of the organization's sales process. It enables managers to carry out a variety of managerial tasks, including intelligence, reporting, productivity, etc.

Activity Log is a page where the agent can get a birds eye view on the day to day activities/tasks held by the sales rep. This page provides a detailed view of each activity or task done by the sales rep. Each conversation made by an agent with the leads are displayed on this page.
Types of tasks: SMS, Call, App, Email, Web Conference or PSTN - PSTN etc.…

Page shows the Number of calls(Inbound/outbound), SMS sent, live calls made and audio files uploaded. Agents/Sales rep can use the search bar to directly narrow down to a specific lead by just entering leads Name, Number or Mail Id to view the task.
Sales rep can customise the page with dropdown options and sort the data on the basis of,
Playlist: Agents can list out tasks based on All, All Liked, Shared by me, Shared to me, Good Calls, Bad Calls and Average Calls
Sort by: Agents can sort by Contact Name, Sales Rep Talk ratio, Call Type, Direction, Duration and Pitch Score.
Download: This button allows the Agent to download the activity log report w.r.t Date range filter that is set.
Date Range Filter: Agents can set the date range for the tasks that he needs to view.
The Funnel button on the top right corner of the page allows the agent to filter out the activity based on multiple requirements.
Conversation Type, Call type, Pipeline, Teams, Stage, Reps, Dispositions, Signals, Call status, Customer Call status, Agent Call Status, Cue Detection, Telephony Provider, GDPR and Duration type.
Short 		         (Duration < 3mins)
Average 	                 (3 min <= Duration < 5 min)
Above Average	 (5 min <= Duration < 10 min)
Good 			 (10 min <= Duration < 15 min)
If the Agent wants to check or analyse a particular call, they can access it on the activity log page on their dashboard.

Each activity or task is divided into two sections on the activity log page, one of which provides a thorough overview of the call and allows you to share activities like adding a playlist or identifying the type of call (inbound or outbound), among others. The other template gives information to the agent about the leads and the sales rep, as well as a call summary, a transcript of the entire conversation, and a display of captured lead and sales rep signals.
To understand about the interface of a specific task on activity log page, (refer the image below)
This part shows an overview of the task/activity. Agents can view all the information associated with the call, including specifics on the call's particular dimensions.
It displays fields on call disposition, Caller ID, Sales Rep Call Status, Customer Call Status, Team name, cues detected and Disconnected by (Agent/Lead).
Agents can Like, Share the task, Download Audio and add task to playlists on the task card.
Deal Value: Shows the potential Annual contract value if the deal is closed/converted.
Total Handling Time: It's the summation of call ring time and talk time duration.
Talktime Duration: Total time taken for the conversation from the time Agent/Customer has picked up the call.
Sales Rep Talk Ratio: Percentage of time the rep spoke on the conversation.
Call Type: This indicates the type of task and the direction of the tasks.
Performed Date: Indicates the date on which conversation has happened.
Sellers Party: Indicates the participant of Seller’s Organisation.
Buyer Party: Indicates the participant of Buyer’s Organisation.
Task Status: This represents if the task is completed or in progress.
Data Publish: Represents if the task was pushed to CRM or not.

This part gives the agent information about the lead and the sales rep, as well as a call summary, a transcript of the entire conversation, and a display of lead and Sales rep signals. (As shown in the image below)

This section indicates the points at which the Lead and sales rep have captured signals that cover the audio file of the entire conversation. It provides a brief summary on what the call is all about.
Sales rep has the ability to playback the audio file and listen to the conversation. They can filter the transcripts based on snippets (with comments, without comments or All) and by Dimensions.
Sales reps can add comments on the snippets and also share snippets through the transcript dialogue box.

Share Task Modal: This modal pops up when the user clicks on the “Share Task” button in the Task card. It allows the user to add comments and share the task to other sales reps within the organisation.

Share Snippet Modal: This Modal pops up when the user has clicked on the “Share Snippet” button that is present on each line of the conversation in the transcript section. It allows the sales rep to add comments and share the snippets to other users within the organisation.
Click on “Activity Log”, User will be directed to the Activity Log page of the Agent Dashboard.

Agents are  salespeople who work for an organisation. Their role is to effectively pitch products to leads and complete assigned tasks. This may involve making sales calls to prospective customers through a specified provider integrated with salesken. The goal is to provide information about the product's benefits and help the customer make an informed decision.

Sales Representative/Sales Agent Dashboard is an interface that shows both the activities the agents have completed in a day and the overall task statistics. Additionally, the dashboard gives the agents flexibility to view their activity log with a custom date range filter. Salesken also provides agents an option to make their call through Salesken smart dialer (Telephony) and make an SMS by creating a template  for it.This interface is necessary for the agents to give an overview on how many tasks have been completed, in Progress and Incomplete.
Agents are given with a unique Virtual Caller Id with which they execute sales calls to potential leads. Each Caller Id is provided to a specific agent by salesken integrated provider such as,

A sales rep needs to have a phone number (such as Airtel, Jio, or Vodafone) that will be linked with the virtual caller ID provided by salesken. Once the two numbers are linked, the virtual caller ID will mask their contact number when making sales calls (to protect their personal number from being exposed to the company's clients). In order to have connectivity, the sales reps phone number needs to have a certain balance and internet connection.
A licensed sales rep who is qualified to perform sales calls can either upload audio files of their sales calls or execute live calls to the customer using the salesken smart dialer.

The salesken smart dialer is an interface that provides real-time cues to the sales reps during the conversation with leads. When a lead uses particular trigger words that have been allocated to the cues, the cues are activated and displayed in real time on the smart dialer interface.
Note: Agents can use this dashboard only if they are a Licensed user within the organisation.
Steps to land on Home page of salesken Agent dashboard:
Login to your Agent/Sales Rep account using salesken agent credentials.
Steps to initiate Call on salesken agent dashboard:
Click on the “CALL” button on the top toolbar.
Enter the phone number of the lead
Select the medium in which you want to call (Internet/Phone)
Click on the “record” toggle button if you need to record calls.
Set the Pipeline that you want to use for a specific product.
(If pipeline is not selected it automatically takes default pipeline)
Click on the “Call” button to initiate the call.
Steps to send SMS through Salesken Agent Dashboard:
Click on the “SMS” button on the top toolbar.
Select the number you want to send SMS from the drop down on the top right corner Adjacent to the “Send New Message '' button.
Select the Template if any, on the template drop down menu.
Type the message you need to send by typing on the “Type a message” box.
(Maximum Characters for a message is limits to 1600)
After the message has been drafted, Click on the “Send” button on the bottom right corner.
Sales rep/Agent - send a message to a new lead,
Click on the “Send New Message” button on the top right corner of the page.
“Send message to a new lead” Modal appears.
Send the new lead the message you need to convey by typing it in the message box.
Now the user has sent the message to a new lead.

Agents can compare the data on specific dates by using a custom date range filter on the page. Agents can compare the analysis across sales reps and leads using the filter option
Signal Intensity: Density of signals captured across a lead.
The Funnel button on the top right corner of the page allows the agents to filter out based on,
Sales reps. (can choose multiple sales reps)

Objective: To compare sales reps performance with respect to their signal intensity covered on dimensions for their leads. To get an overall view on how effectively the signals are being used across each dimension from the sales reps and the leads.
It provides a plot on  Win Profiles and Averages across the company w.r.t signal intensity across each dimension on its leads.
This analysis can be done with agents by measuring the dimensions on the basis of Script Intelligence and Selling best practices.

Comparative Analysis is a graphical representation of Signal intensity w.r.t dimensions across each sales rep and leads. It tells the measured intensity of signals across each dimension covered by the agents during the calls. It provides the projection of

Sales Rep can Add lead, Bulk Add leads, download leads and filter leads by setting specific date ranges. They can search for any lead assigned to them within the organisation by entering the lead name/email/number/company name on the search bar.
On leads page each lead will be shown in a block, as shown in the image below,

Activity Log is a page where the sales managers can get a bird's eye view of the day-to-day activities/tasks of the sales reps. This page provides a detailed view of each activity or task done by the sales reps. Each conversation made by an agent with the leads is displayed on this page.
Types of tasks: SMS, Call, App, Email, Web Conference or PSTN - PSTN, etc.

The page shows the number of calls(Inbound/outbound), SMS sent, live calls made, and audio files uploaded. Sales Managers can use the search bar to directly narrow down to a specific lead by just entering the lead's Name, Number, or Mail Id to view the task.
Sales Manager can customize the page with dropdown options and sort the data on the basis of,
All, All Liked, Shared by me, Shared to me, Good Calls, Bad Calls, and Average Calls.
Contact Name, Sales Rep Talk ratio, Call Type, Direction, Duration, and Pitch Score.
Download: This button allows the manager to download the activity log report w.r.t Date range filter set.
Date Range Filter: The manager can set the date range for the tasks that he needs to view.
The Funnel button on the top right corner of the page allows the manager to filter out the activity based on multiple requirements.
Conversation Type, Call type, Pipeline, Teams, Stage, Reps, Dispositions, Signals, Call status, Customer Call status, Agent Call Status, Cue Detection, Telephony Provider, GDPR and Duration Type.
Short                (Duration < 3mins)
Average           (3 min <= Duration < 5 min)
Above Average (5 min <= Duration < 10 min)
Good                 (10 min <= Duration < 15 min)
Long                  (Duration >= 15 min)
To understand the interface of a specific task on the activity log page, (refer to the image above)
If the sales managers want to check or analyse a particular call, they can access it on the activity log page on their dashboard.

Each activity or task is divided into two modals on the activity log page, one (Task Card) of which provides a thorough overview of the call and allows you to share activities like adding a playlist or identifying the type of call (inbound or outbound), Download Audio, etc... The other modal (Transcript section) gives information to the manager about the leads and the sales rep, as well as a call summary, a transcript of the entire conversation, and a display of signals caught from the call (audio file).
This part shows an overview of the task/activity. The manager will see all the information associated with the call, including specifics on the call's particular dimensions.
It displays if the call was disposed or not disposed, Caller ID, Sales Rep Call Status, Customer Call Status, Team name and Disconnected by (Agent/Lead).
Talk time Duration: Total time taken for the conversation from when the Agent/Customer picked up the call.
Performed Date: Indicates the date on which the conversation happened.
Buyer Party: Indicates the participant of the Buyer’s Organisation.
Share Task Modal: This modal pops up when the user clicks on the “Share Task” button in the Task card. It allows the user to add comments and share the task with other organization users.

This part gives the manager information about the lead and the sales rep, a call summary, a transcript of the entire conversation, and a display of lead and Sales rep signals. (As shown in the image above)
The entire conversation between the sales representative and the lead is structured in the transcript with references to captured signals.

The sales Manager has the ability to playback the audio file and listen to the conversations. They can filter the transcripts based on snippets (with comments, without comments, or All) and by dimensions.
This Search Bar allows the Sales Manager to search for particular snippets within the transcript model.

Share Snippet Modal: This Modal pops up when the user has clicked on the “Share Snippet” button that is present on each line of the conversation in the transcript section. It allows the user to add comments and share the snippets with other organization users.

Comparative analysis is a page that allows the sales managers to compare the signal Intensity w.r.t dimensions such as Script Intelligence and Best selling practices. It provides a plot of Win profiles & Averages across the company w.r.t the signal intensity across each dimension.
Sales managers can compare the data on specific dates by using a custom date range filter on the page. Sales managers can compare the analysis across multiple sales reps and overall org leads.
The Funnel button on the top right corner of the page allows the manager to filter out based on,
Teams and Sales reps. (can choose multiple sales reps)

Objective: To compare multiple roles ( Sales reps/teams/All org leads) across all dimensions like Script Intelligence and Selling Best Practices. To Compare how effectively the signals are being used across each dimension from the sales reps and the leads.
Signal Intensity is the density of a signal across a lead.

Comparative Analysis is a graphical representation of Signal Intensity w.r.t dimensions across each sales reps/teams/All org leads. It tells the measured amount of signals across each dimension for leads/sales reps the sales manager has filtered.
Sales managers can download the comparative analysis report by clicking on the download option on the page.
Steps to go to Comparative Analysis page in Sales Manager Dashboard:
Click on “Comparative Analysis”, User will be redirected to the Comparative Analysis page of the Sales Manager Dashboard.

The home page of the sales manager dashboard is a page that provides the managers with an overview of all the activities/tasks performed within the organisation. It provides signal-wise coverage across all dimensions that are segmented by parts such as Script Intelligence, Selling Best Practices, and Emotions. Here all the dimensions are gauged from (Poor - Good) and managers can check this analysis for a particular lead or across all leads within the organisation.
The sales Manager can sort the dashboard for Leads and conversations with a custom date range filter.
The Funnel button on the top right corner of the page allows the manager to filter out the data  based on multiple requirements such as,
For example: Greetings,  Objections, price query, payment related, etc...

The page provides the Sales Managers to a look through an overview of all the dimensions as well as an overview of each dimension for all leads. They can see if agents/Sales reps have missed any stage (gaps) and try to suggest them in their upcoming conversations with the leads. Managers can set the dashboard date range and filter the dashboard based on the defined pipeline and its stages. They can use it to analyse the organisation's overall performance, identify its weak points, and take steps to become more efficient and provide better outcomes.
Dashboard elements that are displayed to managers for thorough organisation monitoring are,

Script Intelligence: Script Intelligence is a platform where the agent can evaluate the total effectiveness of the sales calls and activities that have been done. The manager can examine the success at each stage of dimension on this block. Dimensions are classified based on the external dynamics of the call.
Opening: How effectively a sales rep Initiates the conversations.  For example: Hi, good morning, what is your name?...

Lead Qualification: How extensive are your reps/agents on asking quantifiable questions to identify the right prospects.  For Example: If an agent is trying to sell a Laptop, he needs to make sure he is calling students or people in need of a laptop. (prospective buyer)
Price Discussion: Shows how successful are the Sales Reps on navigating the product pricing discussion.

Selling Best Practices: This block provides signal-wise coverage for dimensions mentioned w.r.t Selling Best Practices. The dimensions are classified based on the best practices that are necessary to be followed by the agents/Sales reps during their sales calls.

Playbook Intensity: Shows the coverage of time spent across all Dimensions for all leads. This is represented by a donut chart that is segregated into dimensions and further broken down into signals. (As shown in the image below)
Emotion Charts: It shows the coverage of all emotions from Customers and Agents. It consists of a toggle button that helps the managers to switch between the charts w.r.t Agents/Customers.

This segment deals with the internal dynamics of the call. This conducts a sentimental analysis of the customers during the call, showing the emotional tone of the message that the customers are trying to convey.
Assertiveness: Indicates on how assertive the agent is during their conversations.
Satisfaction: Indicates the satisfaction level of the Lead during their conversations.
Joy: Indicates if the Lead is excited during the conversation.
Compassion: Indicates the level of compassion between the sales rep and lead.
Curiosity: Indicates if the sales rep is able to generate curiosity in the lead.
Frustration: Indicates if the lead is frustrated during the conversation.
Leaderboard: This block provides the Top 3 performers of the organisation. Needs attention is a section that shows in what area the sales rep/agent is lagging. (Gaps)
Top Scoring Calls: This section shows calls with the highest pitch scores w.r.t agents/sales reps.
Managers get direct access to conversations in this section and have the option to like, share tasks, and add conversations to playlists.
Clicking on the More hyperlink opens up a detailed tab of that call.
There are blocks that provide the overall insights of the organisation on the dashboard,
This section provides managers with the overalls in all fields such as,
Total Conversations, Meaning conversations, Quality conversations, Total Durations, Signal Insights, Cues Shown, Connect Ratio, and Talk Ratio.
Teams: This block provides the data and stats specific to the teams.
It shows the Team names, members of the team, Conversations, Total Duration, and Cues that were triggered.
This new feature shows a Heat Map chart on your team's performance w.r.t  Percentage of dimensions that are covered in Script intelligence, Emotion signals, and Selling best practices.

Objection Breakdown: This block displays the objections raised by the leads during the sales conversations. There are two sections: one field shows the Objections and the other part shows the conversations with the number of instances the particular objections have occurred.
In the bottom left corner, it indicates the total number of entries and entries that are shown in the block.

To access the Admin portal visit with the URL https://web-us.salesken.ai/
You can log in to your account using your registered Email address and password
This feature enables the “Admin” to manage all the users in the organization easily. In the list on the user page, you can view and manage all the user details.

The Users Page will open by default when you log in with your admin credentials on the Salesken Portal. You can also access the user page on the “Admin” portal by clicking on the “Menu button” at the top left side of the screen, then selecting “Users” from the side navigation menu bar.
From the user management tab, you can perform user management tasks, such as
Add User:  Create or add a single user to the organization
Bulk Add: Upload multiple users at once to the organization
Download: You can download all the user data
Edit: Edit user information, like their name, role, language, and configuration
Activate/Deactivate User: You can activate and deactivate the user’s account when required. When you activate a user, the user gets Licenced.
Reset Password: Reset the user’s password by sending them a reset password email
Show Activation Logs: See the log of activation/deactivation of a user historically with the date and time stamp
Send Welcome Email: Send a welcome email to a user with their username, and password for Salesken
Filter: You can filter the data based on two criteria: A. Licenced/Non-Licenced Users B. Subscription Status
You can add any user to your organization, including a single user or you can also add multiple users at once
You can activate a user if and when you want them to become a licensed user
You can deactivate a user when you want to take away the license from the user
You can send a reset password email to any user in the organization
You can see the activation logs for any user in the organization
You can send a welcome email with the username and password for their salesken account to any user in the organization
You can see the following information on the Users page about every user in your organization:
Name - shows the name of the user
Email - shows the email address of the user
Phone Number - shows the phone number of the user
Subscriptions - shows the  names of the users subscribed by that user
Caller Id - shows the caller id of the user
User Role - role given to that user
Team Name - the team that the user belongs to
License - if the user is licensed or not

A user with a manager role on Salesken can subscribe to the user/team to view the reports and analytics insights, along with the activities and actions performed by those users/teams. Once you subscribe to a user/team, any new activities and actions performed will show up on the manager’s dashboard and the analytics for the subscribed users/team can be viewed.

User subscription enables the admin to configure the subscription for the user with a manager role on Salesken. Admin can update/configure the subscription based on the hierarchy of the user for whom the subscription is being configured.

There is a user Alpha with a manager role on Salesken, and he is a team leader of 5 representatives. Then the admin will configure the subscription for Alpha as 5 the representative who reports to Alpha.

There is a user Beta with a manager role on Salesken, and he is a team leader of 6 representatives. Then the admin will configure the subscription for Beta as 6 the representative who reports to Beta.

There is a user Gamma with a manager role on Salesken, and he is a manager for Alpha & Beta. Gamma would like to view the performance of the representatives reporting to  Alpha & Beta. Then the admin will configure the subscription for Gamma as 5 representatives who report to Alpha & 6 representatives who report to Beta.

There is a user Delta with a manager role on Salesken, and Delta is a trainer for the new joiners present in Alpha’s & Beta’s team and would like to track their progress. Then the admin will configure the subscription for Delta as new joiners reporting to Alpha & new joiners reporting to Beta.
Similarly, the admin can configure the subscription for any user with a manager role and the user view the activities of the subscribed users.
Click the hamburger menu on the top left corner of the screen, and select the  “User Subscription” option.
Once the User Subscription page opens up, click on the filter button on the top right of the screen and choose the sales manager you want to manage the user subscription from the dropdown.
Post this you will be able to manage all the users/teams subscribed by the selected manager role user.
By user subscription, Admin allows the manager to subscribe/unsubscribe to a single or all the users available at once. The respective Manager can see the available users and their subscribed users.
In this search field, Admin can search for a specific user to subscribe/unsubscribe to that particular user.
Then you can subscribe/unsubscribe to a particular user.
You can also click on the “Add All” button to add all the users in the organization as subscribed users for that Sales Manager.
You can also click on the “Remove All” button to remove all the users in the organization from the Sales Manager subscription.
You can also double-click on any user in the Available Users column to turn them into Subscribed Users for that Sales Manager.
You can also double-click on any user in the Subscribed Users column to remove them from the Subscribed Users for that Sales Manager.
By team subscription, the Admin can subscribe to a single or entire team at one time. Each manager can see the available teams and their subscribed teams.
In this search field, Admin can search for a particular team to subscribe/unsubscribe to that particular team.
Then you can subscribe/unsubscribe to a particular team.
You can also double-click on any team in the Available Teams column to turn it into a Subscribed Team for that Sales Manager.
You can also double-click on any user in the Subscribed Teams column to remove it from the Subscribed Teams for that Sales Manager.

Caller Id is a virtual number that is assigned to a user with a Sales rep role on Salesken and the user would be placing calls via Salesken. Callerid is the virtual number that gets displayed to the customer(customer of the user) when they receive the call from the user.

It is a unique number assigned to each user based on the geographical location of them making a call. Caller-id can be a virtual number that resembles with mobile number or a landline number of a particular geographical location. A user can have one or multiple caller-id assigned to them.
On this page, you can manage the caller ids for your organization.
You can see the list of all the available caller Ids in your organization, including the ones that have been assigned to the users in your organization.
You can assign/ reassign the caller Ids to different users in your organization.
→ On the page you can see the following information about each caller Id:
Spam Status: this shows if a caller Id is Spam, Likely Spam, or Non-Spam.
Spam- If the calls made by a particular caller Id are not getting connected 90% of the time, then we declare that number as spam
Likely Spam- If the calls made by a particular caller Id are not getting connected 70% of the time, then we declare that number as likely spam
Non-Spam- If the calls made by a particular caller Id are not getting connected for less than 70% of the time, then we declare that number as non-spam
Assigned: This shows which user in the organization has been assigned that caller Id
Connect Ratio: This shows the percentage of connects that happen for that particular caller Id
Bought Date: Shows the date and time when you bought that particular caller Id for your organization
Provider: Shows the provider that provides that particular Caller Id
→ On the Caller Id Management Page, you have the following features:
Search Bar:  You can search for any specific user
Buy a Number: You can buy any number you want for your organization
Download: You can download all the data on the page
Filter: You can filter all the data based on two criteria:
If the caller Id has been assigned to a user or not
Mark As Spam: You can mark a number as Spam
Mark As Default: You can change the default caller Id for a user if they have been assigned multiple caller Ids
Assign: If the caller Id has not been assigned to anyone then you can assign it to any user in your organization
Reassign: You can reassign an already assigned caller Id to someone else in your organization
Release From Salesken: You can release a caller Id from Salesken and it won't be assigned to anyone and you can reuse it later
Release From Provider: You can release the caller Id from the Provider and then you will no longer be able to access that caller Id in your organization

A product is a good / service sold by the organization. It captures and contains the sales process/scripts and assets of the product being conversed by the users. Real-time cues and signals are configured at a product level. A single Product can be assigned to multiple teams, and each team can be assigned multiple products. A Product can also be assigned to multiple Pipelines.

And help you solve the conversational challenges and win the deals with insights into these conversations in real-time and post-call.
