Objective :  The purpose of this document is to define the process of adding new CRM/Telephony systems  and time required to build the connector.
Integration Use case  :  We build connector to support following standard integration use cases
Integrate sales call with CRM to  get more insights  (Telephony +CRM)
Integrate CRM  for lead and revenue intelligence ( CRM)
Integrate Telephony system  to get conversation analytics (Telephony : PCA)

Prioritisation  : Each system is evaluated for its business value and prioritised for building the connector.  A weekly review meeting is held to set priorities with different stakeholders.                              Stakeholders :  Engineering , Sales, Partner & Product.

System Availability (License) : If system comes with trail license , then we create trial account and proceed. If system doesn't come with trial license , then license procurement  is needed. We acquire license either by partnership or direct purchase.  Stakeholders :  Engineering , Partner and Finance
Understanding of System : We understand basic functionality of systems and integration use cases. CRM system
Here is a basic list of tasks that must be completed for a CRM system.
a. Configuration : Configure User and Customer fields. Understand the  API enablement .

b. CRM Entity understanding :  Create & update lead , contact , opportunity, Task/Activity and custom entity .  Check the relation between these associations (Lead-->Opportunity etc) and how to build these relationship.
c. Understand the field  and usages.      Some important information like deal/revenue storage needs to be found . Other storage we look for states and win loss information.
d. Sales process flow : Configure pipeline and stages. Update the lead with pipeline data and different      stages field and update .
e. Create and update users . Add and update user details.
f.  Integration flow : Conclude how to map call details with Lead and where to keep call information.
g. Click to call functionality  : How to enable click to call functionality in system.
Telephony System
Here is a basic list of tasks that must be completed for a Telephony system.
a.  Configuration :  Configuration of Users , Call enablement , Channel , Timezone and enablement of     real time streams.
b.  Making Call:   Make a call and end a call from the system.
c. Understand the mode of calls available with the system. (Inbound/Outbound/Conference)
d.  Understand the timezone in which call data is getting published
e. Understand the call lifecycle and its  status along with call party status.
f. Availability of audio recording and their format. (Audio extension, sampling rate and their channel : mono aur dual)
4. API evaluation  : Once we have basic understanding of system , we evaluate the APIs to integrate with Salesken. Here is how we evaluate API :
5. Development :      Once concluded with feasibility, development starts under a process. (refer dev process section for details)
Here is high level task for CRM & Telephony system
CRM                                                                                                                                                                                  a. Authorization
h. Dev integrated testing and big fixing
c. CDR Import : Fetch call metadata along with audio recording
d. Data storage : Audio recording manipulation if needed, Handling inbound/outbound call, stages computation, connection
e.  Dev integrated testing and big fixing
f.    Documentation
Below is the details around Test process for new Integration request of CRM/CDR -
7. Documentation :   Here we build a non technical document which can be sharable to all.  This document contains following information  :
a. Summary about system and web link.
b. Integration use cases
c. How to configure in salesken .
For CDR :  It takes 7-8 days of time with 1 person of effort
For CRM : It takes 10 days of time with 1 person of effort
Acquisition of commercial license takes around 2 to 3 weeks of times.
1.5 person per day  ( UI , Backend and Testing)
This is integrated testing and bug fixing.
This is done during testing time. Effort of 2hr is needed
1.  Sprint Allocation:  A sprint is assigned to connector. There are two sprints in a months of 10 days.
2.   Story Planing :      Developer understand , plan and estimate the Task.
3.    Daily scrum :   All the development  tracking is happening in daily team scrum.
4.    Iterative development:   Development is happening in chunk and frequent commit are happening.
5.     Code review :   All code are getting reviewed and getting scanned with static code analyzer namely Sonarlit.
6.    Code is getting committed against story.
7.     Iterative testing :  Dev is planned in a way so that  testing can happen in parallel .
Testing Process - Below is the details around QA PROCESSES -
Sprint Planning - QA sprint align with Dev Sprint.
Story Grooming - we provide all details, dependencies, entry and exit criteria for deliverable.
Task Allocation and Estimation - Task creation for each story with resource allocation and estimation.
Test Planning - this activity is combine of Test case writing and review. we also plan test according to req and use case.
Test Execution - Execution of the planned test as per define test methodologies and cases around.
Bug Validation - After planned execution we plan bug validation after issue fixes.

This document will provide all the information necessary for the execution phase such as the project's goals, objectives, the scope of work, limitations, and resources of Salesken’s integration with Google Calendar along with Webinar Integrations like Zoom, Google Meet, and Microsoft Teams. In this doc, the positive flow of integration is discussed along with known issues and the issue which are to be targeted in the next release.
Salesken’s user has the same email id as the google email he is using. i.e. while integrating calendar user’s email in salesken must be the same email that he/she authorizes.
Users with the same domain (i.e. all users having email ending with “@salesken.ai" ) must be in one organization.
We only create tasks only when the activity/meeting is scheduled with at least one person/email outside the organizer’s domain.
Calendar fetch is a scheduled cron job that runs every 5 min.  As a result, the creation/updation of any event will take a max of 5 min to reflect.

Meet/Zoom bot joining process is initiated 2 minutes early. So, if the event is changed just before 2 min will not impact stop the bot to try joining the meet, and failing to join will result in blank task creation(in case of meet only but in case of zoom PCA will work but real time cueing will not work).

The bot runs on the pre-scheduled google calendar events. The lead and SCP creation will be done on the calendar level. If any new participant joins the meeting without a calendar invitation. The bot will treat it as a Lead but will not be able to create a Lead/SCP.
What if User is invited from external buyer party for a google meet/Zoom meeting? And what if there are two user of same organization in that invitation?
The exact information of Agent or Customer Snippet as Calendar name and google meet/Zoom meet name might vary.
Support for multiparty for all actors/participants of the Meeting/Webinar.

Proactive cueing: Based on multiple turns to date

Autopilot: Completely driven by ai with no choice by agent
Custom: Agent picks the cues he wants for specific dimensions (cue can be made by agent? cue recommendation path - closest to original ideal as per sales manager)

Proactive - at the beginning and end
Out of specific goals set by team leaders/ managers
Cue feedback at the end of the call for inputs into the next call written by the agent
Generic & canned : Selling best practises, emotions, motivational, converation parameters
High context- playbook for script, call summary, manager driven
Questions from all old calls, answers from winning calls - should this be all calls?

Arbitration logic : When multiple cue types are possible at a given turn and cues need to be sequenced, the proposed order is emotion > reactive > proactive
If the reactive cue is out of sequence, always have a proactive cue following in 10 secs - to stick to sequence

Playbook cues are cues that are related to the on-going conversation.  They are of different types:
These cues are around the 7 script intelligence dimensions:
These cues should be based off some threshold values through the call

Sequencing: Sequencing of these dimensions is based off a) an ideal sequence  at signal level created in the onboarding wizard b) 1-n sequences at signal level that can be discovered in the win calls.  The assumption is that sequencing is relevant in winning playbooks and data will find the sequences in winning calls.

Feedback loops : If a dimension has incomplete coverage, a feedback loop can discover the gaps and cue on the missing dimensions. This is particularly helpful when mandatory signals are present in the onboarding data.  ​Tagged user @Vaibhav Verma@Vaibhav Verma ​Tagged user @Sahul Darla@Sahul Darla ​Tagged user @Sandeep Sahu@Sandeep Sahu In onboarding wizard we need to have option to select mandatory signals
Conversation state: These cues are also triggered on the basis of turn based win/loss model which will predict the next best action on the basis of highest win probability at any given turn
In a custom control mode, the agent can also pick what cues he would like to see outside of the recommended cues by having access to it at the click of a button.
Unlike the playbook dimension cues, these cues have to be triggered through out the call.

There is no sequencing for these cues as they need to be present at all times.  Selling best practices could potentially have a correlation to script intelligence cues in some combination like this (data on this should be collected for every customer)

Empathy: Demonstrate empathy for your customer's situations.  Examples of empathy sentences:
I am sorry you are going through this
Rapport building: Build a strong rapport with your customer by enquiring about his/ her job, family, sport, passion, interests etc
Positive energy: Sound more positive on the call. Smile, use words that convey good energy, speak in a louder volume.
Urgency: Create urgency for next steps through offers that may expire, discounts or limited availability
Consultative: Ask more questions and understand the customer’s needs better.  Why have you enquired? What problems are you facing? What are your goals?
Listening:  You are talking too much.  Ask the customer questions and listen more.

The sort By option allows managers to sort the data the basis of date and duration of the conversation in ascending or descending order.
To use preset sort metrics, complete the following steps:
Click the “Sort By” to display the sort options.
In the Presets list, select a preset sort option.
Sort the data according to duration of the conversation
Sort the data according to time of conversation.
Results will get sorted in descending order and if the user will click the same preset in sort by option again then it will get sorted in ascending order.
To apply the Date Range Filter, In the date range filter list, select the Date range filter for the desired the data.
The filter is a dynamic date filter, such as Today, Yesterday, Last 7 Days, Last 30 Days, This Month, Last Month, Lifetime and Custom Range.
When you have filtered the dashboard and want to go back to where you started, click the filter option from the filter and select the previously selected filter date.
You can filter conversation details by using the data range filter based upon following timeframes:
Today - Shows the data for the time period that includes the current interval
Yesterday - Shows the data for the previous day
Last 7 days - Shows the data for the previous seven days
Last 30 days - Shows the data for the previous 30 days
This month - Shows the data for the current month, with no extra days
Last month - Shows the data for the previous calendar month with no extra days
Lifetime - shows the the data from the time period of 1922 - current date
Custom range - You can filter the data by setting a specific date range.
Select a range of dates to define a fixed range of dates to filter. For example, you may want to see all the the data between January 12, 2020 and May 14, 2021
In the date range filter list, click the ”Custom Range Filter”.
To define the date period, use the calendar interface to select the date criteria (e.g., January 12, 2020).
You can use the forward and backward arrows to navigate by month and year.
Click the backward arrow to get the appropriate month and year, then click your first date. Navigate to the end date. Click the end date. Your selected custom date will appear below the Apply button.
You cannot select the future date in the custom date filter. Editing and deleting are restricted in my activity tab. Your reporting manager can access your activity column.

Notifications are updates about the activities of your Salesken account. Salesken keeps you informed about the work that you care about, whether you are at work or not. In the Profile Overview option, notification stats will display the notifications triggered for calling, SMS and event triggers like when the event started, ongoing event, ending event, errors occurred in initiating event. The recent updates are also notified like adding new leads, call disposition, incoming calls and the messages.

1. Inbound call notification : The user will be notified for getting an inbound call the Salesken provisioned number, before the call lands. 2. Report download notification : The user will receive a notification when a report download is initiated and it has been prepared.
3. Outbound call notification : The user will be notified when a call is initiated by a sales rep then their manager also gets the notification informing them that a call has been initiated.
4. Lead management notification : The user will be notified when a lead is marked lost or won by a sales rep.
The user will be notified for the following:
When user misses an inbound call and call goes to voicemail.
When weekly or daily signal achievement goal not met.

An audit log provides an immutable record of how user the data is created, modified, and accessed. This is the view of audited information in the user profile and more information about each event.
It keeps a record of all tasks done by the sales rep regarding lead with the timestamp.
It also keeps the trace of changes a sales rep has made.
All the changes will be reflected in the audit log. The update will give a quick overview of the changes made to the profile.
Changes made by the manager will also be reflected.
Audit Log events are generated by the Salesken system. They are driven by the user action. Sales rep cannot configure, disable, sort, edit, and delete any information displayed in the audit log.
Click the “User Profile” on the top right side of the dashboard.
It includes updates regarding changes made in lead name, lead email, lead phone number, company name, company URL, company city, lead symbol & value and Lead Pipeline Stage.
Note: It does not include password changes when the Salesken forces users to change their password at sign-in. Alternatively, the manager may change the password.
It gives information about the  event’s time when the changes were made and  are displayed in the order in which it occurred.
Actions performed (Mark as WON/ Mark as Lost)
When users perform the action mark as won or mark as lost, the respective changes appear in the audit log. Lead lost reasons also get captured.
When users edit the pipeline stage, the respective changes appear in the audit log with a message.
When users change profile pic, the respective changes appear in the audit log with a message.
When users change the Name, the respective changes appear in the audit log with a message.
Whenever there are new messages coming, the respective changes appear in the audit log with a message.

(View your most important reports in a single window)A dashboard is a collection of widgets for reports and analytics, allowing managers to rapidly monitor the performance of your teams or analyze the link between various the data generated by your team or individual rep. It contains an overview of Intelligence Reports, Team Statistics and Objections breakdown.

The Intelligence reports gives a detailed description of how the sales reps are performing while conversing with the leads. There are various signals that get caught in the conversation that help to analyze it.

On the dashboard, you can see the summarized details with respect to how your team/Organization is performing in their conversations with the leads. It consists of Playbook Coverage, Playbook Intensity, Leaderboard and Top scoring calls.

Shows the Signal wise coverage of all won leads vs your leads. It shows the signal-wise coverage of all leads and also of won vs lost leads, which we can see by clicking the toggle the top right of the Playbook Coverage placard. You can switch between All Leads and Won vs Lost.
Shows the Signal wise coverage of all won leads vs your leads.
This chart shows the presence or absence of the playbook dimension across all leads which had at least one meaningful call.
This chart shows the comparison of the presence/ absence of playbook dimensions between won and lost calls.
The sunburst chart shows the time spent across all dimensions of all the leads. It shows the intensity of the dimensions in the calls made by the sales reps in the team/organization.
The First layer of the chart from the inside shows the intensity of the signals while the second layer shows the intensity of the sub-signals.
This shows the details about the top 3 performers among all the sales reps and also the reps that need attention.
Here you can see the calls with the highest pitch scores.

It is the signals caught during the conversations. Signals are subheads under each dimension. Signals have categorized the basis of the speaker of the signals and it may vary from the lead to the lead depending on the industry of the lead.
They are classified as Generic signals, Industry-specific, and Custom signals.
Generic Signals: Signals that are generic for all the leads such as Opening, Closing.
Industry Specific Signals: Signals converge at an industry level for the following dimensions Lead Qualification, Need Discovery, and Objection.
Custom Signals: Signals for those dimensions are usually highly unique to a lead such as Product Knowledge, Key-value proposition.

A good manager can make a great team and business, it requires good analytics on reports. The sales manager reports features enable faster analysis and faster resolution. The section will display real-time insights about their team's progress and activity. You can access different types of reports depending on your needs. It helps to analyze the overall performance more effectively and proactively, monitors the sales activity as well as the sales rep endpoints across your organization, and also provides other reporting data across sales.

This article will help you get to know the reports, various analysis capabilities in sales, and why we use this feature. Salesken gives you the ability to construct individual reports or teams and also gives you a robust tool for pulling and gathering data from your Salesken website. The following section will provide you with a list of reports that will be helpful as we explain this feature and how it is used.
teams and also gives you a robust tool for pulling and gathering data from your Salesken website.

Signals are predefined keywords that are detected when the sales rep says a particular word or sentence to the lead. Signals make it easier to measure the quality of each conversation.
It also helps the sales reps to evaluate the coverage of all the necessary clauses of sales during the conversation.
A real-time algorithm analyzes calls quickly with the help of signals that help to show the performance statistics. We can get a comparative summary or report through signal analysis.
When a sales rep calls a lead, at that time the signals during the calls are caught to analyze the conversation, and a summary of the call is generated in order to move in the right direction.
It shows the signals in the form of a bar graph.
It represents categorical information with rectangular bars with heights or lengths proportional to the values that they represent.
The bars can be plotted vertically. All the Semantic signals are quoted on the X-axis of the bar graph and Y- the axis represents the coverage.

Each signal is quoted in a different color, when a sales rep hovers the bar it will show the signal name and the percentage of the coverage. Also, it should be accurate as per the call analysis in other reports like activity log comparative analysis, etc.

These signals are generated through the product signals created by the manager. For example, whenever the lead starts a conversation by saying 'Hello, Good morning. That greeting signal will be caught in the conversation.

The progress % is displayed for each sales rep subscribed under the particular manager. The data for different types of Dimensions/Signals can be checked by navigating the different tabs as follows-
Script Intelligence (Eg:- Opening, Lead Qualification, Need Discovery, etc )

The progress % of the signals can be calculated for 3 different timeframes as per the filter:-
Daily- shows progress % for yesterday as compared to the day before yesterday
Weekly- shows progress % for the current week as compared to the previous week
Monthly- shows progress % for the current month as compared to the previous month

If today is the 10th of July thenCurrent month = 10th of June to 9th of July,  Previous month = 10th of May to 9th of JuneCurrent week =    3rd of July to 9th of July,     Previous week =   26th of June to 2nd of July
Navigate to the Signal analysis page and  Filter by the rep
Check the particular signals' instance count for yesterday(OR current week/month) (Value a) and the day before yesterday(OR previous week/month) (Value b)
Validate the Improvement percentage by the below formula:((a-b)/(a+b))*100
If the signal improvement of a dimension is 0% for a rep, then all the sub signals inside that dimension should also have 0% improvement.
Reports on productivity metrics provide insight into how productive your monitored teams are. It is one of the most important and impactful pillars in every business.

Comparative analysis reports the process of comparing the signal coverage and distinguishing their similarities and differences.  When a manager wants to analyze the business challenges, performance, and quality, doing a comparative analysis enables them to better grasp the problem and develop solutions to address it.
Comparative Analysis page is a report based the signal coverage comparison between two reps. It shows the coverage in percentage.
The Comparative Analysis report allows you to group together multiple teams by successful calls, so you can answer questions such as:
Comparisons let you quickly evaluate and monitor the activities side by side.
Report on Comparative Analysis cannot be downloaded.

You can compare the signal percentage in the successful call and the signals caught in the overall team. In this report, you can visualize your team performance. Use this feature in order to discover how your team has performed with successful calls. For example, when you access your comparison report, comparing the the data will help you discover the quality of the team.

Correlation Report shows the relationships between the signals, it measures how the signals are related to each other. It analyzes and shows how the signals are correlated with each other according to the number of conversations in which they are caught.

Observed signal measures the association between a correlation signal and quantifies the correlation between the two. This facilitates a deeper understanding of the behaviors that drive lead conversions, and can help guide product decisions.
Click the “Signal to observe” drop down, select the observe signal.
[Observe signal: The signal which you want to monitor and compare with the correlated signal] .
Click the  “Signal to correlate” drop down and select the signals which you want to correlate with the observed signal.
Following are the few options to correlate signals

Select the one observed signal and correlate it with one signal, it shows the total number of calls the observed signal caught and how many correlated signals are caught in those calls and the percentage of the observed signal in the correlated signal caught calls.

Select the one signal to observe, and correlate with many signals, it shows the total number of observed signals caught calls and how many correlated signals caught in the same observed signals caught calls. It also shows the percentage of the correlated signals in the total number of observed signals detect calls.

Select more than one signal to observe and correlate with one signal, it shows the total number of calls each observed signal caught, how many correlated signals are caught in the same observed signal caught calls and the percentage of the correlated signal detected in the observed signal caught calls.
It shows how many observed signals in the calls and how many correlated signals caught in the same calls and the percentage of correlated signals in the observed signals caught calls.

Call Controls is a feature that enables the managers to Barge, Listen, and Whisper  into the  live conversations taking place on SalesKen Web Portal.
To access the Call Controls page, you must have logged in as manager.

The ADMIN can control the setting in admin settings for Primary Mode of Calling to Conference. If the Conference is selected as a calling method, This enables sales rep to make an outbound call as a conference call.
Barge ,Whisper and Listen can only work if the call is a conference call and this should be configured at a user level and the Sales Rep should have initiated a conference call not a normal call.
Conference Owner:  shows the name and phone number of the Call Owner who has initiated the call.
Sales sales rep: shows the name and phone number of the sales rep.
Leads:  shows the name and phone number of the lead.
Actions: allows the Manager to do multiple functions over ongoing calls. They see all the ongoing calls in the Call Controls page and can choose to:
Barge Call Barging is a feature that allows the Manager to drop in on live calls between the Lead and the Sales Rep.
Barge Active Call View (Manager View)

Using this feature, the manager can join the ongoing call as a conference participant. Both the parties (sales rep and the lead) can hear what the manager is saying  and the manager can hear what both of them are saying.
Once the manager joins the call, an announcement happens in the call which is heard only by the Sales Rep, that only lets the Sales Rep know that manager has joined the call.
This feature gives the advantage to the manager/supervisor to give live instructions to the sales reps.
Call Whisper is a feature that allows the manager to join in on live calls between the lead and the sales rep, but only the sales rep can listen to the manager's voice.
Whisper Call Control (Manager View)
Whisper Active Call View (Manager View)
Using this feature, the manager can join the ongoing call as a conference participant but only the sales rep can hear what the manager is saying.
Once the manager joins the call, an announcement happens in the call which is heard only by the sales sep, that only lets the sales rep know that manager has joined the call.
Live calls is a feature that enables the manager to see real time  conversations taking place between the sales rep and the lead.
The Salesken application has always been used by multiple Sales Reps to make calls.
However, earlier there was no way to see the status of Live Calls or to see which Live calls are currently active.
Now, managers have the ability to view Live calls and see the Live transcripts to peek into the conversations between the sales rep and a lead.
Managers can choose among any of the current Live calls listed the page to view the ongoing conversation.
Click the menu button the top-left to select the “Live Calls” option.
For live calls, the admin must select the “Call” option as the primary mode of calling.

The purpose of this note is to document the pain points being solved with Salesken (and is designed more from a marketing lens).

Salesken was built after the founding team spent over 10 years training over 20,000 freshers into the sales role. Over 10 years, the team trained sales reps, starting with behavioural science approach (training) and moving to a productized solution with speech ai.

Over time the solutions to helping reps sell better ranged from in person classroom training to canned content delivered on an e-learning mobile app to voice bots that would operate like mock sales calls on a mobile app to post analytics on sales calls.  The team eventually landed on real time cueing during a live sales call as the best way to help close a sale, building around a core philosophy of ‘learning by doing’.

Learning to sell is a lot like learning to drive a car.  It is an applied skill.  You cannot learn to drive a car through classroom training or reading a book or watching a graph.  You learn to drive a car with a coach that sits next to you while you drive, who nudges you through the process of actually driving it with inputs that help you build better and acquire muscle memory.  Salesken is the designed as the coach, the mind of all your best sales reps that nudge you with cues as you actually navigate the live sales call and help acquire muscle memory on selling best practices.

Salesken is a GPS for sales reps, a tool kit that provides directions to successfully navigate a sales call to a win! Similar to how excel works for bankers, Salesken helps process a ton of the complexity involved in selling and provides a simplified interface to sales reps through short format cues.
There are 3 broad groups of personas that the Salesken product currently targets:
The problem: High complexity of skills for selling <> Low skilled sales reps

Selling is the ability to influence the mind of another human to buy a product/ concept being sold.  After analysing several million calls, Salesken analytics suggest that influence is established when the buyer
·        Finds a platform to express his pain points, concerns
·        Develops confidence and trust in the sales rep.

At different stages of the sales call, best sales reps bring in different technical and soft components to the conversation. We call stages of a call as playbook dimensions in Salesken. There are 7 playbook dimensions in the Salesken product – Opening, Lead Qualification, Need Discovery, Product Demo/ FAQs, Key Value Proposition, Price, Closing that are analysed basis the rep’s voice.  There are an additional 7 dimensions that are evaluated under ‘Selling best practises’ – these are soft aspects of selling and include Empathy, Positive Energy, Consultative, Rapport Building, Listening, Urgency and Confidence.  Apart from the above, several dimensions are also analysed from the potential leads voice such as Objections, Competitors, Intent to buy, Decision makers etc.
Some of salesken’s ideal sales call playbook (based off data of winning calls) look like below:
From the above, there is a complex inter linking of hard and soft elements required for a win at different stages of a sales call. For example, lets take the opening dimension.
Signals involved (typically) : Greeting, Self Credentialling, Organisation Credentialling, recording consent

Example of opening “ Good morning, Mr Bates, this is Jay calling from RX Bank, one of America’s largest mortgage company. I am a relationship manager at RX bank and i noticed you have applied for a mortgage on our website. I am calling in connection with your enquiry, is this a good time to speak with you?
Skills required at the call opening stage: Script, high positive energy, confidence, rapport building, listening

However, the need discovery stage requires the sales reps to have a more consultative approach and listen, with empathy to the customers response to the queries asked. Product demo dimension requires sales reps to have very high technical knowledge and demonstrate confidence. Closing requires sales reps to create a sense of urgency around the next steps.

Sales reps struggle even with the technical parts of the product, as they are usually do not have strong technical backgrounds. The complexity of the products/ product suites and features sets are not entirely understood during the call.
Consultative selling skills are mostly missing as most sales reps tend to dive straight into the product feature selling, without sufficiently investigating the customer pain point.

Sales is also a hunting activity, often leading to failure and rejection. Funnel conversion rates are barely over 10% points, which means on a sales reps get rejected on atleast 9 out of the 10 calls are rejections. Sales reps struggle to motivate themselves after a bad call and continue to bring positive energy, confidence and passion into all of their calls.

The repetitive nature of selling also makes the sales reps anaesthetic and the calls sound scripted, robotic and not personalised.  Sales reps do not fork the sales pitch as per varying customer personas, often sticking to a one size fits all approach.

Selling is the ability to read the mind and emotion of the potential lead and convert the mind of a lead from a base to a place of high interest.  This requires a high level of emotional capability, which are missing in a large number of sales calls.

Given the high complexity of delivering a great sales call, there are large differences between the lead conversion numbers between the best sales reps and the remaining sales reps.  Best reps are technically sound, have high EQ, have discovered hooks or patterns that work, personalize their calls, are consultative.

The lead conversion losses between the best sales reps and the rest of the reps is what we call “preventable losses”.   Natural losses may be on account of lead quality, timing etc.  Preventable losses however are attributed largely to the variation in sales conversations between best reps and the rest of the team and can be reduced significantly, if the rest of the reps are nudged and guided towards better sales conversations.
Lets take an example of an insurance customer:
Average leads converted per month by top reps
Average leads converted per month by bottom  reps
Sales closed by top reps per month $
Sales lost by rest of team per month $ (Preventable losses)

We have seen preventable losses for customers for various segments go upto potentally 200%, Salesken has potential to massively improve the topline by even a small closing of gap in the preventable losses.
The way Salesken does this through democratising the intelligence found in winning calls across all sales conversations and improving the conversion numbers across the funnel.
Customers using salesken cues have seen their conversion numbers improve by 25%-200%

Proactive cues : These include cues from the script, and are timed to ensure the sales rep remembers to ask all the lead qualification questions, need discovery questions. They are also designed to provide product demo knowledge, provide pricing data, closing next steps.
Reactive cues: These cues are from the customer voice and provide the contextual understanding of the customers voices and pops up the best responses in that situation

An organization may use data masking to create a fake, but realistic version of its data in order to protect sensitive information while still providing a functional alternative when real data is not needed.
Reduces the risk associated with data sharing and cloud adoption.
Keeps the data useful for authorized parties while ensuring its security.
Makes the data inaccessible to an attacker while maintaining many of its inherent properties.

The obfuscate leads option lets you mask the lead details on the product for managers and sales reps. It allows the admin to restrict the visibility of lead details in the portal. It prevents organizational data breaches. To add or edit the restrictions, you will need to be an admin.
It allows the admin to decide whether the manager has access to customer details or not. So in that case privacy of the lead will be maintained.
When masking is enabled, any Manager logged in Salesken portal, will see all fields containing Customer Personal details like phone number, email id masked in the format ‘xxxx-xxxx-xxxx
When masking is enabled for any manager then he will not be able to see the customer details in downloaded reports.
When masking is enabled, any sales rep logged in Salesken portal will see all fields containing Customer details like phone number, email id  masked in the format ‘xxxx-xxxx-xxxx
When masking is enabled for any associate then he will not be able to see the customer details in downloaded reports.

Cues are a set of FAQs that are configured to assist Sales Reps during a conversation with the lead. This report gives an overall analysis of the cues which are caught in the conversation between the sales rep and the leads. During a call with the lead, the sales rep is shown a set of instructions at different points of time during the conversation.
Managers can now see Cues-related insights on a new report under Reports called Cues Analysis, where a Cue-wise summary can be seen for different cues that were detected.
Coverage- Ratio of occurrence of cues in percentage.
This report will only be visible if the ADMIN has enabled REAL TIME CUES in the admin settings for the whole organization.

This report table gives an idea about the percentage coverage of all the cues. The vertical axis represents the coverage of cues in percentage while the horizontal axis represents the name of the various cues.
When we hover over the graph we can see the name of that particular cue and the percentage coverage for the same.
It shows the names of all the cues available.
It shows the number of times a particular cue is detected within a conversation.
It shows the percentage of conversations where the cue was detected.

API required to build PCA for Dailer systems
Authentication API :  Authentication API to access Dailer programmatically. For example : OAuth, API key , Token , basic etc authentication method can be used.
Call record for a given date time   : Given a date range , we can get call records.   Call record should containing following metadata. * denotes mandatory to have it
Each dialer has it's every call to be identified uniquely
Sales representative agent number from which call is made
Name of customer on which call was made (E.164 format)
Can be same as agent number or routing number
Note :  Dual channel audio is mandatory .  If audio is mono channel , then Salesken need to be informed.
Note :  Dual channel audio is mandatory .  If audio is mono channel , then Salesken need to be informed.
User API:   List of users containing basic user information like user name (first ,last) , mobile number , email  etc.   This helps us in bringing right set of users automatically in our system.
Call record filtered by User :   Getting calls records based on users .
Authentication API :  Authentication API to access CRM programmatically. For example : OAuth, API key , Token , basic etc authentication method can be used.

API to get entity details with criteria:    Entity refers to lead , opportunity or contact or task or similar /customise entity of CRM. Given a phone number or email address or date ,  API should return a list of entities.  In general, criteria can be put on all the attributes .

API to create and update entity :  The call details are recorded as task in Salesken. To replicate this task to  CRM  as  task/activity type , API is required .   Ideally this API should be generic to create any entity based on business need.
API to get entity meta data :   API should return list of entities in CRM for example : Lead , Opportunity , Account , Custom objects etc.
API to get  sales pipelines  : Details of pipelines.   Some CRM supports multiple pipelines .
API to get stages of sales pipelines :  For example : An  Opportunity can have stages like “demo scheduled”  , “deferred” etc.    This will be used while computing WIN-Loss analysis
API to get user information :  Sales contact users details  of CRM like user name ,  email ,  phone number etc.
API to get system and customer field information

Linux User (logging access): GCP-PRODUCTION-LOG (linux group: logging-group)Key Required: GCP-PRODUCTION-LOGPermissions: tail -f ~/catalina.out (Read only)

Because this ASR model requires GPUs to scale it makes sense to get a deep learning image like below:
You can also run the ASR on CPU by changing the docker-compose.yml file and commenting the line runtime: nvidia and skipping the following steps.
A sample image you can get from Amazon Web Services, Inc.'s marketplace.

Deep Learning Base AMI (Ubuntu 18.04) Version 46.0 - ami-044906ce6dd9f1bceBuilt with NVIDIA CUDA, cuDNN, NCCL, GPU Drivers, Intel MKL-DNN, Docker, NVIDIA-Docker and EFA support. For a fully managed experience, check: https://aws.amazon.com/sagemakerRoot device type: ebs Virtualization type: hvm ENA Enabled: Yes
If the image is not available we can create the image by following these steps:
First, please pull the following images from docker:docker pull deepgram/onprem-engine:3.16.0-rc1docker pull deepgram/onprem-api:1.49.1
These images are protected so you will have to login to docker using docker login, you can get your credentials whitelisted by either the CSM of Deepgram or use existing credentials (sic mine).
Then you can run the service by doing the following steps:
Install the latest Nvidia drivers if you haven't already
Edit the directories inside the docker-compose.toml to point to wherever you place the engine.toml and api.toml that are attached. Note the models path should be a directory
Download the models from the models.txt file provided, and place these in your models directory
In the directory you placed the docker-compose.yml file, run docker-compose up -d
Run docker ps to make sure both services are up and running
You can check what models are loaded by sending a request to /v2/models. So if your API container is running on localhost and port 8080, that'd be curl http://localhost:8080/v2/models
Finally, when you send a request, you'll have to specify the model, version, and language (if non-english)
You can see the metrics of the server using:
Once these steps are done we can see a list of models by doing:
We can do streaming recognition by doing hitting socket URL:
If you add more GPUs to the same machine, you will linearly increase the the throughput by the same factor for each additional GPU. DeepGram will automatically distribute the work across the GPUs
4 core machine can run 2 parallel sessions of ASR
With a GPU like Nvidia K80 you can run 40 parallel sessions
If you want to run ~100 use Nvidia P100.

Manager Portal - Reports - Signal Analysis Calculation
It is the ratio of number of Conversation where the particular (category/signal name/ signal value) was caught / Total number of quality conversation of the one above in Hierarchy.

It is the ratio of number of Conversation where the particular (category/signal name/ signal value) was caught / Total number of quality conversation within the previous date range of same length as of the selected date range of the one above in Hierarchy.
Graph Calculation :- It is the ratio of number of Conversation where the particular signal was caught / Total number of quality conversation.
Instances :- Number of conversation of the particular signal category occurred in the particular time range.
Progress :- It is the difference of coverage and previous coverage. (i.e. coverage - previous coverage)
Instances :- Number of conversation of the particular signal name occurred in the particular time range.

Progress :- It is the difference of coverage and previous coverage. (i.e. coverage - previous coverage) (Here the coverage/previous coverage denominator is total number of conversation where the category of that signal name was caught).
Coverage : It is the ratio of number of Conversation where the particular signal name was caught / Total number of Conversation where the category of that signal name was caught.
Instances :- Number of conversation of the particular signal value occurred in the particular time range.

Progress :- It is the difference of coverage and previous coverage. (i.e. coverage - previous coverage) (Here the coverage/previous coverage denominator is total number of conversation where the signal name of that signal value was caught).
Coverage : It is the ratio of number of Conversation where the particular signal value was caught / Total number of Conversation where the signal name of that signal value was caught.

Dimensions, Signals and Sub signals are the crux of the Salesken Analytic and Cueing framework.  They are the inputs into the system that are detected in real time and post call through a variety of data science techniques.  '

Dimensions:  Dimensions are groups of signals, that are common across all sales calls.  Dimensions are used to provide an analytic framework for evaluation of sales calls.  Dimensions are more generically understood by sales leaders and sales reps.  They have been used for various Sales analysis like BANT, CHAMP, MEDDICC etc.
For Salesken, we have analysed these dimensions in more detail.  There are common dimensions as below:
Selling Best Practises (to be built out by the DS team ​Tagged user @Ashish Kumar@Ashish Kumar ​Tagged user @Suvro Banerjee (Tech Team) (Unlicensed)@Suvro Banerjee (Tech Team) (Unlicensed) )

The above dimensions are constant through every sales call. This set of dimensions will be used for all reporting frameworks in Salesken.  Additionally, if customers want to add their own dimensions, they can do so under a third head - of Custom Dimensions.

Signals: Signals are subheads under each dimension.  Generally signal heads many vary from customer to customer depending upon the industry of the customer.  The goal is to create a signal head library of commonly used categories that will also help new customers build up a script.

You had enquired about our course on the edutech website
You had left an enquiry for this software
I would like to inform you that this call is being recorded. Are you ok with this?
How much SIP do you wish to do monthly?
Do you get sufficient time with your kid
Does your sales team perform at its optimum
Are you currently happy with the performance of your sales team
Are you able to track your sales teams performance?
Do you have sufficient analytics on the last mile of your call
Compare between best sales reps and other reps
We will speak again about the next steps
Signals can be categorised on the basis of the speaker of the signals:
All dimensions and signals on the agent/ sales rep’s voice contribute towards a pitch score for the agent.
All dimensions on the lead’s voice contribute towards the intent to buy score for the lead.

Signals can also be classified as generic, industry specific or custom.  The expectation is that the data science team will build out all the generic and industry specific signals, which should just be on for the customer.  The only set of signals the customer has to configure should be the industry specific signals, which should be also automated by the SMS.
Signals are of various types depending upon the degree required to configure and the source of the data:
Generic dimensions : Generic dimensions have the following characteristics:
Applicable to all industries and all contexts
Datasets for all these signals are pre-existing and created by the data science team ​Tagged user @Ashish Kumar@Ashish Kumar and the BI team ​Tagged user @Ravindra@Ravindra
They are always on in the salesken product
Emotion signals on customers voice  (​Tagged user @Ashish Kumar@Ashish Kumar ​Tagged user @Suvro Banerjee (Tech Team) (Unlicensed)@Suvro Banerjee (Tech Team) (Unlicensed) )
Generic signals: Some kinds of signals are generic for all customers.  Examples are:
Opening - Opening signal will have these same signals for all customers.  Sub signals will however vary
Industry-specific signals: Some kinds of signals converge at industry levels for the following dimensions:
Lead qualification - some of the signals  and sub-signals under lead qualification are likely to converge at an industry level
Need discovery some of the signals  and sub-signals under need discovery are likely to converge at an industry level
Objections of some kinds -for example, I do not want online classes as I like in-person interaction is an objection across all edtech
Custom signals: The signals  for these dimensions are usually highly unique to a customer:
Product Knowledge - This is what makes the customer unique in the market and will be a high context signal
Key-value proposition - This is a summary of what makes the customer compete in the market and by definition is unique to the customer articulation

The goal of Salesken is to move towards a complete self serve product.  The ultimate vision for Salesken is that the signals auto-populate and the net onboarding time is TEN MINUTES.  The customer should ideally only select and label clusters under the right signal heads.   We have to arrive at the sophistication where the customer downloads the Salesken app, starts calling from it and a whole bunch of reports come up.  After making calls for about 2 weeks from the app, the customer should be able to have the signals autopopulate.
Until that is achieved, signals have to be manually configured for several dimensions under the sales script adherence and for some customer intelligence dimensions.
Data sources for signals: Signals will have the following data sources:
Customer documents that are pre-given.  These include the following:
Some questions and answers that will be asked to the customer during the onboarding - to provide a framework to understand the business of the customer
Past Calls: If the customer is willing to share past call data, that will help the BA team arrive at signals from these call transcripts
New calls: From additional new calls, the data science team can provide clusters which can also be labelled by the BA team

You have the right place to implement your sales strategies. No matter what kind of product you sell, we are here to help you to make it happen. SalesKen workspace is a single platform to perform multiple businesses, where you can organize, manage, and maximize your sales. This guide will help you set up your Salesken account so that you can get started with your business with SalesKen.
Once your manager creates the account for you, you can log in to your Salesken account.
To access the web portal, from your browser, visit http://<V2 URL>/
2. Enter your Login Email address and Password, and click the "LOG IN” button. Now you can start using            your Salesken account.
To sign out from your account, follow the instructions below:
From the Sales rep Dashboard (Home page), click the "Profile pic” or "Name” in the top right of the Dashboard.
You can reset your password by going to the Don’t remember your password link on the login page. Follow the steps below to reset your forgotten password.
On the Login page, click "Don’t remember your password ?”
Enter your Email address in the space provided and click the "SEND EMAIL” button.
You will receive an email with the subject "Account password reset” in your inbox.
Open the email and click the "Reset Password” link in the email.
Make sure to check your spam folder in your email in case you do not see the mail in your inbox.
5. You will be directed to the change your Password page. Now set and confirm your new password and click the "Reset Password” button.
The reset password link will expire after 30 minutes.
To keep your account safe, we do not allow you to use any recently used passwords. You need to create your password by meeting all the above constraints. You also cannot reset your password.
A message will appear after you reset your password: Your password has been updated. Please log in again.
You are all set! Click the "Go to Login” button. On the login page, enter your email address and the new password, then click the "Login” button.
You can click the Remember Me checkbox so you don’t need to enter your password manually every time you log in.
The following topics will assist you in understanding and using the Salesken Sales rep Portal effectively.
The Dashboard gives a brief description and step-by-step instructions of the Sales rep Portal’s main features and applications.
The Dashboard shows you the number of the tasks that you have completed, the activities that are done with the lead, the lead details, uncompleted tasks, and the progress of the deal.
To set up your leads and view the details of the leads, click the "Lead” tab.

Salesken offers a variety of ways to track your sales journey through the Report list. You can view your sales conversations and details, evaluate them against metrics for success, and analyze your productivity pattern.
This gives an idea about how the sales rep performs in the conversation with leads. Various signals get caught in the conversation which helps in analyzing it.
Salesken sends you notifications when you have new updates or messages. These notifications appear on the notifications icon on the top right of the dashboard page.
It will display my profile and sign-out option in the dropdown.

Click on the notifications icon to view the recent notifications. It will keep you updated regarding the latest tasks you performed or need to perform. All the recent actions performed by sales reps are displayed in the notification column.
To view the entire notifications, Click the "View all” button at the bottom of the recent notification column.
View all options in the recent notification takes you to the notification column on the My Profile page.
The user profile service is available to all the users of the Salesken sales rep portal to view and update or edit their profile details post-login on the portal.
Click your user "Profile picture” (or username) on the top-right of the dashboard
In the dropdown, click the "My Profile tab”.
Edit the details, then click the "Save changes” option.
The User can only edit the name while other details can not be edited.
My Profile Page shows the email address, phone number, and caller Ids of the sales rep on the left side of the screen. It also consists of the following details:

You need to log into your account before you can update your profile information. The personal information contains details about the user like name, contact number, and email address with the user’s profile picture.
Choose the location where you find the image which you wish to use as your profile picture and click "Open”.
Only jpg, jpeg, and png formats of the files are allowed and the maximum size of a file allowed is 40 MB.
There is a multiple language feature that enables users to write their names using accented characters. e.g. Noël, Zoë or Mátyás.
Click the "User Profile Picture” on the top-right of the dashboard.
Click the "My Profile” option from the dropdown and navigate to the "Personal Information” option in the left sidebar.
Change your username and click the "Save Changes” button.

The Salesken profile overview shows My Activity and Notifications where sales reps can analyze on their own, getting a clear idea of what has been done, what is pending, and the reminders. My activity shows a general history of your conversations with the lead as well as your actions. Notifications show updates about the activities on your account.
Click the "User Profile” picture (or username) on the top-right of the dashboard.
Navigate to the "My Profile” option in the dropdown.
Click the "Profile Overview” option in the left sidebar of the user profile.
My activity card lets you review and manage what you share with leads.
You can use My Activities to keep track of all your lead conversations.
In the My Activities card, you can see the number of calls you have performed with call duration, date, and time to stay up to date with your recent task activities.
If you click any particular task activity, you are navigated to the "Conversations” Page.

shows the lead profile image with the lead name and transcript duration. Below this, the transcript appears in the conversation tab with the details of signals captured during the call. For example, if we hover over a price objection signal, the signal caught in the particular transcript is "hi”. It also shows the rep profile image with the rep name and transcript duration. Below this, the transcript appears in the conversation tab with the details of signals captured during the call. For example, if we hover over a greetings signal, the signal caught in the particular transcript is "hi”. There is also a search by dimension filter .
The search function helps the sales rep to find any particular words in the transcript and assists in traversing those words in the transcript section.

You can search any of the conversation snippets by using this function.  The typed searched words return all the semantically matched search results or the likely-matching results to the search words.
For example, if you want to search for the words "hi, how are you?” in the transcript.
Type "hi, how are you? ” in the search bar.

You can filter conversation details with a the data range filter based upon the following timeframes:
Today - Shows the data for the period that includes the current interval
Lifetime - shows the the data from the period 1922 - to the current date
Custom range- You can filter the data by setting a specific date range.

Notifications are updates about the activities of your Salesken account. Salesken keeps you informed about the work that you care about, whether you are at work or out. In the "Profile Overview” option, notification stats will display the notifications triggered for calling, SMS and event triggers for when the event started, ongoing event, ending event, and errors that occurred in initiating event. The recent updates are also notified like adding new leads, call disposition, incoming calls, and the messages.
You will receive various kinds of notifications such as:
The user will be notified of getting an inbound call on the Salesken provisioned number, before the call lands.
The user will be notified of sent or received messages to or from the lead.
The user will be notified of receiving the voicemail from the lead.
The user will receive a notification when a report download is initiated and it has been prepared.
The user will be notified when a call is initiated by an sales rep then their manager also gets the notification informing them that a call has been initiated.
The user will be notified when a lead is marked lost or won by a sales rep.
The user will be notified of the following:
When the user misses an inbound call and the call goes to voicemail.
When weekly or daily signal achievement goal is not met.

The Audit log provides an immutable record of how user data is created, modified, and accessed. This is the view of audited information in the user profile and more information about each event.
It keeps a record of all tasks done by the sales rep regarding a lead with the timestamp.
It is the trace of changes the sales rep has made.
The Audit Log will display the activities performed in the user profile of the Sale rep portal.
Audit Log events are generated by the Salesken system. They are driven by user action. A sales rep cannot configure, disable, sort, edit, and delete any information displayed in the audit log.
To view Audit Log, follow the steps:
Log in to your Salesken account as a sales rep.
On the Sales rep home page (dashboard), click the "User Profile” on the top right side of the dashboard.
Click the "My Profile” option in the dropdown.
On the left sidebar, click the "Audit Log”.
The Salesken Audit Log provides the following information:
It includes updates regarding changes made in lead name, lead email, lead phone number, company name, company URL, company city, lead symbol & value, and sales rep.
It includes updates regarding changes made in the sales rep name, contact number, and profile image.
Each time a user changes the account password.
It does not include password changes when Salesken forces users to change their password at sign-in. Alternatively, the manager may change the password.
The event’s time whenever the changes are made is displayed in the order in which they occurred.
Example: moments ago, a minute ago, 35 minutes ago, etc.
The changes made in caller id will be displayed in the audit log.
If the manager makes changes in the sales rep caller id, this will not be displayed in the audit log.
When users perform the action mark it as won or mark it as lost, and the respective changes appear in the audit log.
When users edit the pipeline stage, the respective changes appear in the audit log with a message.

Salesken offers a call button in the sales rep portal. Using this, sales reps can convey important information about the product or service that they hope will hook the lead and result in a sale.
To place calls from the Salesken web portal, click the "Call” option from the sales rep Portal home page (Dashboard).
Enter the number which you want to call from the dialpad.
Once you entered a valid phone number with the country code, you can place the call using two options:
The Organisation of sales reps should have app/proxy calls enabled that can be changed by the support team. If a call is not connecting, contact the Salesken support team.
Sales rep needs to have a valid manager and the Caller Id should be verified. If one of them fails, the sales rep is restricted to navigate to the calling page.
The sales rep should be licensed to place calls. If the sales rep has no license, then the sales rep will not be able to login into the portal.
Internet calling allows users to call leads through their web portal. The Salesken internet calling allows sales reps to call on the lead’s phone number.

In Salesken, proxy calls stand for phone-to-phone calls which means an sales rep will place a call from the Salesken app (Web or mobile) to leads. So that sales rep will receive the first call on his phone device. Once an Sales Rep receives the call, the lead receives the second call. In the lead phone, the sales rep’s phone number will be sales rep caller id. They can start communicating once both sales rep and lead are connected in the same call.

These are mainly known as incoming calls. It comes directly on the sales rep's phone. The lead will call back to the number which is received, that is the caller ID of the sales reps. When a lead calls back to the caller ID number, the caller ID which is mapped to the sales rep number will be receiving a call.
Notification will come first in the sales rep dashboard when an inbound call is triggered to the sales rep mobile.
These are mainly known as outgoing calls. These are the calls made by sales reps to their leads. They can place a call by two options, either through a web app or a proxy call.
You can integrate other call-making applications with the Salesken account.
You can record the call by sliding the record button
For international calls, enter the country code before placing the call. For example, for Brazil, enter +55 before the phone number.

Use Google Chrome, Mozilla, Firefox, or Microsoft Edge to open the Salesken call feature and allow the microphone access on your browser. We recommend you use a network testing tool to test your connection.
Dialer Input: The sales rep enters the lead’s phone number to place calls. The phone number should be prefixed with the country code and must be valid.
Dialpad: It is the platform to dial a number to make calls on the entered number.
Call button: This initiates the call to the lead’s number from the sales rep’s caller id.
Call configurations: This allows sales reps to switch calling types between internet and phone (proxy). The record button provides the sales rep the freedom to record or not record the call.
By default, the calls will be placed on the internet and will be recorded.

It is the signals caught during the conversations. Signals are subheads under each dimension. Signals are categorized based on the speaker of the signals and it may vary from the lead to the lead depending upon the industry of the lead. They are classified as Generic signals, Industry-specific, and Custom signals.

Generic Signals: Signals that are generic for all the leads such as Opening, Closing.Industry-Specific Signals: Signals converge at the industry level for the following dimensions Lead Qualification, Need Discovery, and Objection.Custom Signals: Signals for those dimensions are usually highly unique to a lead such as Product Knowledge, Key-value proposition.

CRM is a technology for managing all our customer’s company relationships and interactions with their customers and their potential customers. The goal is simple: Improve business relationships. A CRM system helps companies stay connected to customers, streamline processes, and improve profitability.  To avoid our customers the friction and pain of changing their workflows, we provide them with the facility to sync data from their existing CRM to Salesken and vice versa.

To integrate any CRM on Salesken, admin users need to navigate to the integration menu from the left option. After clicking on the connect on CRM either a new page is loaded for authorization and login credential or a pop up is displayed to enter Domain name, API Key or Token details.. After getting success response from CRM it will redirect to the integration page again. After successful Integration, CRM will be mapped with the logged-in user's organization.

s have to use  the same login email to sign-up
On Calling the record will be seen in the CRM only if both the login matches.

On dialing it redirects to the Salesken page

Purpose of each action in the Kebab Menu :

Details : Here we can see the API keys and tokens and URL for all CRM no matter how we integrate. This details are different for every CRM and the details are based on login credentials. Hence the details of one login credential will not work for another.

Mapping : When any organization is successfully integrated with one of the CRM present on our integration page. Admin user can get the Salesken-CRM field mapping UI from the option menu present on the CRM name card.
Users can see their default field mapping and can able to add, update and delete the mappings.

These fields can be seen in the Call task created in the CRM.
The default mappings are necessary for the call task to sync with CRM.
Mapping aids to move data from Salesken to the respective CRM under the tasks. We can also provide some constant values - Eg, the taskname of the call record created in CRM.

We can also add custom fields in mapping, hence if any CRM has fields in the Task/Activities to accept the various data from Salesken then by adding the custom fields we can push those data to CRM as well.
Entity :  These are the various ways in which leads or customer details are stored in various CRMs, eg - Account, Lead, Contact etc.
Entity aids to move data from the respective CRM to Salesken.
Help the users to map CRM fields to Salesken fields. All the customer details from CRM are reverse mapped and store in Salesken under the Lead section.
Help the users to map CRM fields to Salesken fields.
Some CRM allows to create custom entities, using Entity option we can map the custom entities to Salesken Lead section as well.

Signal Management System or SMS is an automated process of signal creation for any new or existing organization. It is a concatenated pipeline of various deep learning models and processes that are developed in-house. SMS brings all the different components together in one place to bring out the magic generating domain/organization-specific signals and their corresponding dimensions.

When we onboard a new organisation, the Customer Success team needs to create product Signals and assign them to proper dimensions, so that the Conversational AI engine is able to detect them whenever those are uttered during the conversations occurring between the lead and the sales rep. Signal is the representation of state in a conversation (or any task) which summarizes the part of that task.
The existing process requires manual analysis of calls, and signals are created manually which has the following issues:
Going through calls is a time consuming and lengthy process
many signals can be very simple and hence semantic matching can ignore them
Below are few examples of Signals and their respective Dimensions:

[("I cannot afford to pay", "Objections"), ("I want to surrender the policy", "Objections"),("You need to cover the risk for your family", "Need Generation"),("Thank you for choosing HDFC", "Closing"),("Policy Renewal is due", "Purpose of Call")]
("You need to cover the risk for your family", "Need Generation"),
The aim is to minimize human intervention while creating signals for any organization to avoid lengthy and often erroneous processes.
The aim is to minimize human intervention while creating signals for any organization to avoid lengthy and often erroneous

The solution to resolve the above mentioned issues, is a data centric approach coupled with Machine Learning which will discover the signals. The final objective is to have a self-learning system which automatically discovers these product signals and assign the correct dimensions which can be used by the Conversational AI engine to detect and catch the signals from the calls.

The task is to detect signals from a given set of conversation snippets which contain novel information/topics and have very low correlation with the signals detected so far. For example, during the course of several conversations between multiple sales reps and leads, a lead or a sales rep can start talking about a topic/product/requirement which has not been witnessed earlier. The system should be able to detect these kinds of signals in real-time.
The task is to detect signals from a given set of conversation snippets which contain novel information/topics and have very low

with the signals detected so far. For example, during the course of several conversations between multiple sales reps and leads, a lead or a sales rep can start talking about a topic/product/requirement which has not been witnessed earlier. The system should be able to detect these
The generated Dimensions and Signals are used to provide incredible insights into the last mile of your lead-sales rep interactions.

Even if an organization is using a CRM such as Salesforce or HubSpot, it is essential to analyse every conversation that the sales reps have with the leads. It is noteworthy to mention that every conversation with a lead is an opportunity towards progressing a deal in the right direction. The deal characteristics from the CRM such as deal size, deal name, close date etc, combined with Salesken’s conversation analytics about what was actually discussed with the lead, what were the objections raised and what were the next steps agreed from the previous calls, helps personalize the lead engagement and derive quality insights such as signals, sentiments and confidence indicators to chase the right deals and navigate the conversation towards success.
The insights derived from the conversations of the sales reps and the leads, are expected to be used to track and improve the pitch performance of the reps which helps to crack more number of deals.

This consists of a set of insights around key script “dimensions” including:

A good opening sets the stage for the sales call. For sales calls, time is a crucial dimension as there is a finite amount of time to make an impression on the customer and the words spoken early make a significant impact in how the customer perceives the experience. Credentialing, positivity and high energy are the most important traits of a good opening.
Typical sub signals within the “Opening” dimension are:
Is this a good time to speak to you
It is important for the sales rep to be exhaustive in the qualification in order to identify the right prospect.
Lead qualification is typically done to correctly identify the following:
Fitment of the product/ solution - yes/ no
For Salesken, we define Lead Qualification primarily around:
In SaaS - “Do you use a CRM? Which CRM do you use currently? Which dialler do you use currently?'
For logistics, lead qualification could be “How many bedrooms are in your current house? Could you list the things you wish to move? What is the location of the places you’d wish to move?”

Need identification helps sales reps correctly map the right product out of a bouquet of products/ product features out of a set of features / solutioning for the right need. Understanding customers' needs or pain points early on in a sales call is a critical factor in closing sales. Asking good discovery questions early on in the call helps sales reps contextualise the solution with respect to the customers problems/ requirements.

A good closing is important as it connects the dots between sales calls. A sales rep may cover all other dimensions of the playbook well, but if he forgets the closing aspects of the playbook, the lead has a high potential to die. The goal of a good closing is to ensure that next steps for the call are clearly defined and the call ends on a positive note.

One of the core problems with most sales reps is the rush to start talking about product features. Sales could be sold on:

At Salesken, we have found that a sales pitch based on the product and its features, without emphasis on the buyers needs is a recipe for failure. A sales pitch largely focused on the product does not connect to the customer. The reason why large number of sales reps rely on the less sophisticated product selling is:
Reps feel a sense of control in sticking to a script on the product - product is usually a topic where the rep knows more than the customer
Reps feel a sense of control in sticking to a script on the product - product is usually a topic where the rep
Reps keep talking about the product in an attempt to have conversational control.

Such methods of engagement do not create sufficient buyer engagement as the customer becomes passive in the conversation, rarely talking only listening. There is a strong correlation between buyer engagement, buyer conversation/ responses/ talk time and sales stickiness. To improve buyer engagement and resonance with the conversation, consultative selling has emerged as the better, more sophisticated way of selling.

Consultative selling is a great way to engage the leads. Control over the conversation is harder to achieve in the conversational method of selling. However, it has the great benefit of buyer engagement and buyer relaying his business/ need context.
Reference other pain/ need contexts for other similar buyers/etc.

Empathy is one of the most important skills for a sales rep to be successful. It actually requires perspective-taking. When you are being empathetic, you are doing more than feeling sorry for another person; you are actually trying to imagine the situation from that person's point of view.
I can see how difficult this has been.
I can totally see why you would be upset.

Used to depict how confident are your reps in conversation. Are they using powerful, emphatic, affirmative words? Also, with a deeper knowledge of the product and its features, the sales reps can help boost confidence levels leading to effective selling.

Skilled sales reps create a sense of urgency in potential customers. Without a deadline or time limit for buying your product or service, prospects will often spend time evaluating its pros and cons without making a decision and the sale can be stuck in a limbo. A limbo is the true death knell of a prospect. Death of a sales lead is rarely with a bang, mostly in quiet unresponsive whimpers. A lead open for long can bring up competitor’s, bad reviews etc. An emotion of desire or need created in a sales call has a life…that emotion starts to fade with time and it is a crucial component of a sales process to create urgency to a purchase decision.
They achieve this by combining various clever sales tactics as per below:

Fear - scarcity i.e. FOMO. The fear of missing out (FOMO) is a highly effective technique to create a big sense of urgency. By telling the prospect how many products are left in stock at this moment, or how many spots are left at your exclusive event, you can use FOMO to your advantage.

SIP-based Dialer   and Salesken live stream approach
Dialer has to provide two different audio Stream (Agent and Customer) to Salesken.
SalesKen will expose an API and SalesKen PBX server  for this process.
Dialer will expose their extension on their SIP server.
SalesKen PBX  will dial the extension provided in the exposed api request and initate a call on Dialer Telecom Server  to join the existing call on mute.
We are trying to solve this problem like a muted  conference where salesken server  listens to calls happening on dialer server .
After the call is answered at  Dialer side , Dialer will push the Call unique ID and other parameters such as extension to dial as below  to SalesKen API.
will expose an API for this process  as above

A playbook is a set of signals which can be attached to a product or a process (stage(s)). Previously this set of signals was only configurable for a product

Till now signals are imagined only at a task level that is irrespective of the lead and at what stage the lead is at. To solve this problem playbook comes into the picture. Now we can attach a playbook to any stage or to a product. This enables the ability to capture stage-specific signals. Since we know what kind of signals or things an agent expects to speak at a stage, we can also be extended to cueing for pro-active cue(s) generation.  Types of Playbook

To create signal calculation more in-depth and extract more information out of the conversation based on the stage in which the lead was in during the activity. Also, give more simplified control of signal creation using the playbook creation wizard.
