Cueing can be achieved by audio streams from a live phone call over WebSockets in near real-time.
2)Ozonetel should support streaming in the required format.
When a call is initiated Ozonetel should hit “XYZ” API which will return web socket URL in the below format in real-time:-
This API will instruct Ozonetel to fork the audio stream of the current call and send it in real-time over WebSocket to wss://mystream.ngrok.io/audiostream.

This starts the audio stream asynchronously and immediately continues with the next call back API instruction. If there is no instruction, the call will be disconnected. In order to avoid this, provide a call back API instruction to continue the call.

There is a one-to-one mapping of a stream to a WebSocket connection, therefore there will be at most one call being streamed over a single WebSocket connection. Metadata will be provided so that you can handle multiple inbound connections and manage the mappings between the unique stream identifier or streamId.
If communication issues are encountered with your WebSocket server, they will be reported in the Ozonetel Debugger with additional information about the failure.
There are a maximum of 4 forked streams allowed per call. Each track, inbound or outbound, is a forked streaming.
The url attribute accepts a relative or absolute url. On successful execution, a WebSocket connection to the url will be established and audio will start streaming.wss is the only supported protocol.
The url does not support query string parameters. To pass custom key value pairs to the WebSocket, make use of Custom Parameter instead.
Providing a name will allow you to reference the stream directly. This name must be unique per Call. For instance, stop streaming by name.

The track attribute allows you to optionally request to receive a specific track of a call. On any given active call, there are inbound and outbound tracks. Inbound represents the audio received from the call and outbound represents the audio generated by Ozonetel to the call.

However, if you are using an asynchronous Stream by using the <Start> verb, you can request the audio it generates by choosing outbound_track. To receive both tracks of a call use both_tracks. If both_tracks is used, you will receive both the inbound media event and outbound media event.
The statusCallBack attribute takes an absolute or relative URL as value. Whenever a stream is started or stopped, Twilio will make a request to this URL with the following parameters:
The unique identifier of the Account responsible for this Stream.
If defined, this is the unique name of the Stream. Defaults to the StreamSid
One of stream-started, stream-stopped, or stream-error (see StreamError for the message)
If an error has occurred, this will contain a detailed error message.
The time of the event in ISO 8601 format
When a call is ended Ozonetel should hit “XYZ” API which will close the web socket connection.
There are separate types of events that occur during the Streaming life cycle. These events are represented via WebSocket Messages:
Each message sent is a JSON string. You can determine which type of event is occurring by using the event property of every JSON object.
The following messages are sent from Twilio to your application:
The first message sent once a WebSocket connection is established is the Connected event. This message describes the protocol to expect in the following messages.
Defines the protocol for the WebSocket connections lifetime. eg: "Call"
This message contains important metadata about the stream and is sent immediately after the Connected message. It is only sent once at the start of the Stream.
Number used to keep track of message sending order. First message starts with "1" and then is incremented.
The Call identifier from where the Stream was started.
An array of values that indicates what media flows to expect in subsequent messages. Values include inbound, outbound.
An object containing the format of the payload in the Media Messages.
The encoding of the data in the upcoming payload. Value will always be audio/x-mulaw.
The Sample Rate in Hertz of the upcoming audio data. Value is always 8000
The number of channels in the input audio data. Value will always be 1
This message type encapsulates the raw audio data.
Number used to keep track of message sending order. First message starts with "1" and then is incremented for each message.
The chunk for the message. The first message will begin with "1" and increment with each subsequent message.
Presentation Timestamp in Milliseconds from the start of the stream.
A stop message will be sent when the Stream is either <Stop>ped or the Call has ended.
The mark event is sent only during bi-directional streaming by using the <Connect> verb. It is used to track, or label, when media has been completed.
The value specified when creating the mark message to Ozonetel

Send the clear event message if you would like to interrupt the audio that has been sent various media event messages. This will empty all buffered audio and cause any mark event message to be sent back to you.
The SID of the Stream that should receive the mark
Start a new asynchronous MediaStream named "Example Audio Stream". The stream will begin sending messages to the url specified over a WebSocket connection.
Appie and cueing will be connected through web sockets.
There is a one-to-one mapping of a stream to a WebSocket connection, therefore there will be at most one call being streamed over a single WebSocket connection.
There are separate types of events that occur during the Stream's life cycle.

User subscribers impact everything where we show users' data to the managers/admins, create users, create teams, create pipelines, etc. And if we change the narrative of user subscribers, we will have to make changes to relevant places.

The sales manager can subscribe to users either by selecting users or choosing a team. If A Sales Manager subscribes to a team, then all the team members will be subscribed to the manager, not the team itself. A manager can also subscribe to himself.

The sales manager can subscribe to users either by selecting users or choosing a team. If A Sales Manager subscribes to a team, then all the team members will be subscribed to the manager, not the team itself.
A sales associate can not subscribe to any users.
A sales associate can not subscribe to any users

Admin can create a user with either Manager or Associate or both privileges. And a Sales Manager can create a user with only Associate rights. A Sales Associate can not create any users. A User can have at most three roles. Users can have either Admin, Associate, Manager, or all of them. A licensed user can log in to the Salesken platform. Users can exist without a team.
And a Sales Manager can create a user with only Associate rights
A User can have at most three roles. Users can have either Admin, Associate, Manager, or all of them
The creation of a user will not impact ELK and Redis. This ELK and Redis will only impact during the subscription.
While creating a user, there are some required values you have to pass, such as Name, Email, Phone Number, Language, Role, License, etc.
The user object will be similar to the below one.
The Action performed on user details will impact ELK and Redis alongside the Postgres database.
Admin can edit all the users' details. And the manager can edit all the associates' details. And the associate can edit his / her details from the profile page.
Admin can change the role of any user, and a manager can change the role of associate users.
If an associate's role changed to the manager, then the impact will be on the team(he can not be a part of any team) and the user subscriber(now he/she can subscribe to the others)

If a manager's role changed to associate, then the impact will be on the user subscription(he can not subscribe to anyone and will remove all the previous subscriptions) and the team(now he can be the part of the team)
Admin can activate and deactivate all the users of the organization. And a manager can activate and deactivate associates.
This will impact the user(activate will change the is_deleted false, and  deactivate  will change the is_deleted to true)
Admin can provide a license to all the users of the organization. And the manager can provide the license to all the associates.
This will impact the user license(licensing the user will update the license of the user in the user_licence table),
Admin can reset the password of all the users of the organization. and the manager can reset the password of all the associates.
This will impact the user table(update the password provided by the admin/manager)

Admin is the only role that can create a team. While creating a team admin can add as many users as he wants in a team. A user can be added to many teams. You can not have a team with zero users. Users with only Manager roles can not be part of a team.
The creation of a team will not impact ELK and Redis.
While creating a team, there are some required values you have to pass such as Name, Description, Members, etc.
The team object will be similar to the below one.

Admin is the only role that can edit a team. In the edit team, you can remove a user from a team, add a user to a team, edit the team name team description. This will impact the team and group users table alongside ELK and Redis.

Admin is the only role that can play de a team. The delete team will remove all the users from that team and delete that particular team. This will only impact the team and group users table and not on the ELK and Redis.

Anyone with admin privileges can see all the details of the organization, so the admin can not subscribe to anyone. Only the user with manager privileges can subscribe to all the sales associates of the organization.
The subscription page will have two filters (Associates and Teams) in search alongside download and date range.
From the subscription page, you can subscribe to an associate or unsubscribe to an associate.
When a user gets subscribes all the ELK data of all the tasks performed by a user will impact. And Redis data of the manager will also impact the same goes for unsubscription.
You can log in with the sales manager, sales associate, and admin roles from appie-v2 portal.
This API is used to subscribe to user or team
The manager dashboard will show all the distinct teams data of the users he subscribes. and also all the users(manager subscribed) data.
The team data on the dashboard will not depend on wheater the manager subscribes to some of the users of a team or not.
Can users be created by the Sales Manager portal?
Yes, users can be created from the sale manager portal but only with associate privileges.
Can teams only be created by the Admin?
Yes, only the admin can create a team, edit a team and delete a team.
How can I create an Admin role user?
when you create your organization on the Salesken platform. The first user becomes the admin. Admin can be the only one for an organization.
Should a team be an option while creating a user?
No, As only Admin can create a team, add users in a team, and remove users from a team. And a user can be created from the manager portal also.
Should designation be there while creating a user? If yes. Will there be a dropdown for the list of designations? If yes, will we store the multiple designations in organization settings?
Can only admin privileged users can add and remove users from a team?
Will users activate/deactivate will impact caller id assignment?
No, this will make the code implicit. There is a section where you can assign removed caller Ids.
Will users activate and deactivate will impact licensing?
No, Assigning a license should be a separate thing.
Should password reset will directly reset the password to some default keyword or the password provided by the manager/admin? (Not including the working of profile page password reset.)
Reset the password with the new password provided by the manager/admin.
WIll Un-Spam be the part of the user?
No, It should be the part of caller Id management.
Can a manager subscribe to a different manager?
No, a sales manager can not subscribe to a different sales manager.
In the Manager/Admin dashboard, all the user's details will be alongside the team or only those users' details who are not part of any team?
Do I have to subscribe to myself to view my reports?
Every user will automatically subscribe to him/herself. You do not have to explicitly subscribe to yourself.

An Organization can use any CRM for their purpose, we get the data from organization’s choice CRM and store it into our database. Currently we are having only one CRM configuration  for one user which is organization’s default CRM . We can add multiple CRM integration for an User.
If a user has no CRM then user is assigned default CRM of the org. User can choose any CRM ,so that we can push or pull the data from that CRM.

While creating user,  there will be default CRM. User’s CRM can be changed. If there is a specific CRM for a user there will be a mapping between user and that specific CRM (i.e. details). We check for crm_integration_id in istar_user table, if crm_integration_id is null we will fetch organization’s default CRM by user’s organization. If crm_integtartion _id is not null then we will go for the CRM mapped to that user.
There should be an UI somewhere to incorporate these changes  to make automate this functioality.

In  crm_integration table we get data of organization_id and map it to the CRM .
In istar_user table we check for the crm_intgration_id , if that field is null for particular organization then we assign  that filed to default CRM of that organization.
Particular Organization can be use multiple CRM ,they are not restricted for a single CRM .

Getting calls from a local number increases the chances of calls getting responded to. To solve this problem an associate can have multiple caller ids and the call will be placed from one of the assigned callerId of that region/country. The associate will have at least One caller ID that will be fixed which will be used for every country.
E.g. Assign four callerIds to every associate -three callerIds of assigned countries and one fixed caller id to deal with customers from other countries.

Every associate may be assigned multiple callerId(s). If the associate gets a lead from a country that matches with any of the country codes in his allocated set of caller ids then the call will be placed with the corresponding country code callerId. If the country code doesn’t match with any of the callerIds country codes then the call will be placed from the “default” caller id for this particular lead.
Multiple caller id needs to be available to be assigned to the sales associate.
On creating user we wouldn’t be providing any caller id by default.
Admin will assign a default caller id to the sales associate created.
If admin wishes he can assign caller id of other countries as well.
Caller id of any country can be assigned or released from sales associate by admin at any time.
When an associate places a call to a lead then the customer’s country code will be checked with entries in the country code column and the call is initiated using the following logic.

If the customer’s country code matches with the associate CallerId country code’s field then the call is initiated from the respective caller id and if it does match then the call is initiated with the “default” caller id assigned to the associate.
Use a “default” caller id to every associate for countries whose country code doesn’t match with the country code added in the field.

Accept → Agent picks up the call, need to replace the HTML contents of the page by inbound_calling.jsp. Rest the calling flow continues similar to outbound call.

If user is on any other window instead of Salesken Webapp and then receives an inbound call, this can be looked at two ways:

Adding a boolean column (is_loggedin) in istar_user table, set to true whenever user is logged in and false when user logout’s / session expires / shifted to any tab which is not a part of Salesken WebApp. This will be like maintaing an online / offline status of the user. Thus making it easy to decide whether to call the user or send a notification instead.

Unlike regular calls, conference calls is when more than 2 persons are in a single call, where they can talk and  listen to each other. The associate can add/remove participants to/from the conference call.
An associate (individually) can initiate a conference call and further add/remove participants to/from it.
There are many features described in the SDK on how an incoming participant is joining the call. This allows us to modify the ongoing call according to the use cases.
e.g. a participant can be set to be on mute when he enters the call.
For more information on Programmable call please refer to Twilio Programmable Voice
We are using Twilio SDK for conference calling.
The associate will create a call using the Twilio SDK along with certain parameters required to initiate a call.
This call initialized is an empty conference call with a Room Name (confId) which is created randomly.
Participants are added into the Room as the agent connects the call to them. The participant and room name are created in ConferenceServet.java in salesken-backend
Room Name, Caller Id and To are sent as parameters.
The initializeDialer() in sken_conference.js function is invoked when an associate tries to initiate a conference call. This creates an a conference room with the Room Name that is created.
The associate can add participants using the API, conferenceController.java
This is used to add participant to the room (conference)
contact number of the associate with which the call is initiated
Unique room name for the conference call

The conference call is mapped to a unique Twilio application with a unique TwiML App SID. Also the logs of the conference calls made from the associate are logged into the twilio call logs and the errors are logged under the errors tab (if any).
The TwiML response body is also stored for every participant added to the call.
The callerId of the associate should be twilio verified, else he wont be able to make any calls.
During a call can an associate change the type of the call (normal to conference and vice-versa)?
No, an associate can either make a conference call or a normal call.
How does the manager join a conference call?
The ongoing calls that the associate is engaged with are listed on the manger portal. A manager can choose to join the call, provided the associate initiated a conference call.

Shown above is a possible solution to intercept calls from myriad providers and salvage network packets via sniffing to retrieve audio from the on going call.
1. the agent initiates a call via HTTP request to the Dialer.
2. The dialer then creates two outbound channels with respect to itself and merges them in a bridge.
3. The call is established between the agent and the customer
As the call is happening between the devices with no salesken servers in path the call cant be intercepted
solution: Try to put salesken server in the path of calls. There can be 3 approaches to this
we can intercept at the client device.
we can intercept somewhere in the middle between the client and dialer
intercepting at clients end wont scale as it would require salesken to do some client side config for each client onboarded
intercepting at dialers end wont be possible as dialers wont allow the required access.
to implement 3 we would somehow need to create a pass through layer and then forward the call
We reqister the numbers from the dialer to an asterisk server and the client registers with the same number at the sip client to asterisk

Hierarchy Tree:  Sample hierarchy tree to understand Hierarchy concept
Subscribers: Subscribers are all those users who can see the user’s reports. The list of subscribers is userIds of all those users recursively above this in the hierarchy tree.
For example in fig 1.1 subscribers of SA7 are TL3, D3, VP2, CRO

Reportees:  All those users whose reports a user can see or simply all those users who come below this user in the hierarchy tree. The list of reportees is userId of users recursively below that user in the hierarchy.
For example in fig 1.1 reportee of VP2 are D3, D4, TL3, TL4, SA7, SA8, SA9, SA10, SA11, SA12
Manager: The user which comes directly above the user in the hierarchy tree.
Cache/ Redis Cache: All the Key Objects like  Organization, Pipeline, Product, Team, User are cached in Redis.
These objects are nested in the User object so there are any changes in any of these objects then the Redis cache of the user needs to be refreshed/updated.

Authentication is the process of recognizing a user's identity. It is the mechanism of associating an incoming request with a set of identifying credentials. The identification phase provides a user identity to the security system. The purpose of Authentication is to identify the user’s credentials and to allow login only if the provided credentials are correct.

If task is fetched from Amazon Connect ”Can i get more understanding on this?” Like what is Amazon Connect and features of this?
When an agent calls from AWS Connect. Data about the call is saved at AWS Connect.
We fetch the call data from AWS Connect and get all the details and do mapping required to make a task in Salesken world.
We make the task corresponding to the task fetched from AWS Connect in Salesken.
The Object that we get after speech transcription (point 2). We upload it as a json file at AWS S3 bucked with the file name mentioned at backend (point 3).
Milvus - Open-source vector database for unstructured data.
We use milvus for sematic matching of signals and snippets
Are we going to show any notification to Agent/Manager in case if user analysis limit gets exhausted ?
No there is no such notification being sent right now.
Can we have the list of languages that we are going to support specifically in case of signal analysis?
​https://salesken.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SALV2/pages/1881440297/Analysis+Signal+Management#%3Acheck_mark%3A-Prechecks  For languages supported for speech to text.
Languages supported by signal analysis is only English.
Can we define signal in Hindi OR any supported languages ?
Yes. But right now we encourage only English language to define signals as it is stable.
Other languages defined signals will only be caught by regex service and not accurately by milvus (semantic match)
Where we can define the match method ?
We  don't define match method. They are the methods by which the signal was caught.
If caught by Regex then match method is 'REGEX'.
If caught by Milvus then match method can be ‘MILVUS_LSE', 'MILVUS_USE’
How are we going to address these error codes on UI ? What we will show on UI if these errors will come?
We are not addressing these error codes on UI as analysis is directly not connected to any UI component.
If the service is hit from postman then one can see the error codes and error messages.
what we will analyze with it ? if we will not have STT and signals ?
If we are doing AnalysingWithOutS2T the we analyze few things such as:
If the number of words in a snippet are smaller than 3 and match method is milvus then that signal is removed.
If words in a snippet are smaller than 3 and if get matches with milvus then we remove it cause snippet length < 3 should be regex matched.
Maximum number of signals that can be added?
You can add as many signals as you want.
Can there be signals defined in hindi or some other language?
Other languages defined signals will only be caught by regex service and not accurately by milvus (semantic match).
This Reports section will contains the details regarding all the calls happens between the agents and the customers.
Reports :- Report page presents post call information in an organized format.

Comparative Analysis :- comparative Analysis page is a report based on the signal coverage comparison between two reps/agents. It shows the coverage in percentage.Coverage :- Ratio of occurrence of signal in percentage in all tasks performed by the reportees of the manager. Formulae - (no. of calls in which the signal was caught / total of calls made by the logged in associate) * 100Success for a signal :- Lead can have 3 statuses i.e. WON, LOST, INPROGRESS .Example :- Suppose total calls made by the logged in associate is 100 and out of which 40 calls having lead status as INPROGRESS , 30 calls having lead status as LOST and 30 calls having lead status as WON and out of 30 WON calls let’s say 15 calls are having LEAD QUALIFICATION as a signal so the success percentage for that signal will be (15/30)*100 i.e. 50% which means 50% of the calls with lead status as WON has lead qualification get caught as a signal.

Bar Chart :- A bar chart or bar graph is a chart or graph that presents categorical data with rectangular bars with heights or length proportional to the values that they represent. The bars can be plotted vertically or horizontally. A vertical bar chart is sometimes called a column chart.
Example JSON Data for the activity_log index

SearchingSearching can be done via rep name and normal search.
Date FilterFiltering can be done via date range …
Chart Specs :- The chart compares the coverage of signals for every reps ,success calls and lost calls, with the help of a bar chart. Their will be separate chart per signal.
X-Axis :- This will show agent name and success.
Y-Axis :- This will show coverage of signal.
On-Hovering :- On hover over any bar it will show the agent name and coverage of that signal .
Logged in Associate can see the coverage of signals of other reps also and can compare their coverages.
Subscribers idTheir is a must condition to retrieve the data that is semanticSignals.name or emotionalSignals.name should exist and user.id must be equal to the logged in user id.

Lead management helps you view the lead details and comprehend lead information. Here, you can easily add the lead and organize it with your leads in your Salesken account. The lead stats are assigned to each associate separately.

The Sales Manager (SM) Lead page illustrates users' lead data, who report to their subscribers of a definite period. The Sales Associate (SA) Lead page explains the leads assigned to them and others leads if they call them the same lead.
The data shown on the lead stands on hierarchical connections, which indicates that each SM should subscribe to a particular rep to view its data in the lead.
Lead management mainly has six functions: Sort, Upload, Add Lead, Download Lead, Search, Date range.
Learn how to sort and organize the lead list to make it worthwhile for evaluation.
Note: if you have already applied any filter, e.g., Search and Date range filter, you can sort the visible data according.

Ascending is used to sort the data in ascending order - from A to Z alphabetically or from the smallest to the most significant number for numerical data.Descending is used to sort the data in descending order - from Z to A alphabetically or from the largest to the smallest for numerical data.
Performed Date- The Performed date, the date the lead was contacted recently.
Pitch Score - Pitch score of a lead.
Deal Value - Deal value is the value of the deal/lead. You can update the deal value from the lead details page.
Conversations - The number of conversations made to the particular lead.
By default, the data is sorted by the updation of a lead in descending order.

Empty data values are not considered while sorting which means if you sort the data with deal value and in some data points, there is no deal value exists then those will not come top while sorting by ascending order. and if all the data point does not have deal value then sorting will not happen.

The data will be sorted by default in descending order when you sort it; if you wish to sort the data in ascending order, click again on the equivalent filter, then it will appear in ascending order. Concerning the filter URL will update.
There are two ways to add leads to your Salesken account.

Note: Mobile number and email address should be unique. If no email address is passed, the default email address will be unknown-<phoneNumber>@unknown.com. If no name is passed, the default name will be <phoneNumber>.
Note: When a Sales Associate or a Sales Manager adds a lead, its default status is CREATED. And when Sales Associate makes a call the status becomes INPROGRESS.
Note: Mobile number is only required field while creating or uploading a lead
Note: Associates fields shows all the associates which a manager subscribes.
Import leads from different CRMs into your Salesken account and follows up your Salesken account leads. To Upload your old leads into Salesken Account, follow the steps.
If you are storing your lead data in any database application, you will have to save all your leads data into an xlsx spreadsheet.
Note: If you are importing leads from different sources, the leads data of the company and contacts are out of sync.
Need to implement after the release of 2.0.4
To upload lead data, click the Upload button on the lead page. Click on the Upload button will open a page where you can upload an XLSX file.
Ensure the file is in the XLSX format, and the file size is not more the 40MB.
If you stored the lead details in the database, copy them to a spreadsheet or convert them to an XLSX formatted file.
Make a structured data set. Columns names are mandatory. You can refer to Sample FIle to learn more about the columns.
You must enter column names in the excel file. These are the different lead attributes or fields like Name, Company name, Email, etc.
There is some regex validation happening for all the column values. Refer RegEx Validation Section
Drag and drop the file or file you would like to upload to your Leads onto the local machine or click select a file. Locate where you have saved your XLSX. Select the file. Click the open button.
Once you upload the file list of leads, details will display as per the file in the Lead Reports.
In Lead Report, there are three tabs as follows.
Create: In the create tab, you will see all the rows, e.g., lead detail that does not have any errors; in other words, these leads will be created when clicking on Submit button.

Update: In the update tab, you will see all the rows, e.g., lead detail that does not have any errors, but there is already a lead created with the same mobile phone number. When clicking on the Submit button, these leads' data will be updated with the new data from XLSX.

Ignore: In the ignore tab, you will see all the rows, e.g., lead detail, with some errors. You can either fix these errors or ignore these leads. There is also an option to download the leads that has some errors. The error file name is randomly generated. Click on the Save button will not add these leads to your account.
There is an option for searching; you can search with any keywords, e.g., Name, Email, Job Title, etc., in your XLSX sheet.
You can see the number of leads that will be created, updated, and ignored upon submit.
Make sure your data looks like you’d expect it if any columns are misaligned or missing the lead detail. Fix the XLSX file and upload it again. For Sample Excel Sheet.
If the detail makes sure this is checked, Once the list is confirmed, click SUBMIT LEAD button.

You will get a confirmation once the Lead will upload shortly, then click OK. Upload leads may take some time depending on the size. So It’s recommended do not to upload the same file twice till all the leads get uploaded.
Note: Upload lead from XLSX file is an asynchronous process.

Note: The sample files contain example lead details. Your file likely has all the details marked in the sample file. The first column should be the column header. If you use the sample file to create your import file, then make sure that you remove all the example leads.

At some point, you need to download and keep your entire lead detail. Whether you're migrating to any other CRM or you'd like to create the backup of your data, we've got you covered. You download all your lead information stored in Salesken.

Download your leads as an XLSX file by clicking the Download Button. The download leads are based on the current filters in place. You will get a confirmation popup for the Download Action Triggered. This is an asynchronous process and this may take time depending on the size of the data. The name of the Excel file will download_Leads-SaleskenReports_<CurrentTimeInMiliSec>.xlsx.
We will send you an email with a downloaded attachment to your registered account.
If you cannot find the email in your inbox, check your spam/junk folder.

Who becomes the actor and owner of bulk uploaded leads?

The owner of all the leads will be the user(who uploads the file irrespective of its designation)'s manager and if the user's manager does not exist then the user Itself becomes the owner. And the actor of all the leads will be the user itself.
What is the difference between owner and actor?

The actor will be the associate of the lead who is making calls to that lead. and the owner will be the manager of an associate if the associate does not have any manager then the owner will be associate itself.

Follow Up :- Follow Up page provides a visual display of the average number of conversations that the rep had with the lead, with the help of a line chart. Follow Up displays the graphical representation of average follow up for the date range specified which represents the number of tasks that were performed on the leads by the reps in the given date range and the average follow ups is calculated accordingly.

Example :- suppose their are 5 lead and their is total 5 conversation with each lead then avg follow up will be {(total no. of conversation)/(no. of lead)} i.e. 5 .so avg follow up is no. of conversation per lead.
Line Chart :- A line chart or line plot or line graph or curve chart is a type of chart which displays information as a series of data points called 'markers' connected by straight line segments.
Lead :- Lead is basically that person to whom an associate(or agent) sells their product.

​Emoji :bookmark_tabs: Prerequisites terminologies and technical terms

Reports :- Report page presents post call information in an organized format.Objection :- The Objection report displays a list of objection detected signals. It's basically two types of objection detection.

Objection detection breakdown by rep:  In this section, a list of agents displayed which got the objection signals, the count of all signals corresponding to each agent, the bar chart of objection signals, and the percentage of each signal
Objection detection breakdown by objection:In this, their is the list of objection signals, the count of each signal, high chart of all signals.

Catchphrase's :- suppose a call is going on and in the mid of the conversation customer objected the agent with a line or a phrase i.e. It’s too much expensive. so after the completion of the call their will be objection get caught as a signal with a catch phrase i.e. It’s too much expensive.
KTdatatable:-KTDatatable is a Metronic's custom plugin to load the datatable record from the serverReportees :-

Data : All data in this report are coming from ELK i.e. ElasticSearch.

Elastic Search :- Elasticsearch is a search engine based on the Lucene library. It provides a distributed,   multitenant-capable full-text search engine with an HTTP web interface and schema-free JSON document.

Activity Log :- Activity Log report contains the information about the task or call done by the associate to the lead. It contains some details about the lead, agent, type of the call and duration of the call etc. Activity log for associate is for the logged in associate to see their own task details.
This UI of this Page has three sections :-
Filter and Download Section ( Sorting , searching , Date range and Download )

Sort byData can be sorted by 1. Contact name (Agent’s Name)2. Talk Ratio (Agent/customer)3. Type of the call (Inbound/Outbound etc..)4. Direction of the call (Inbound/Outbound)5. Duration of the call6. Pitch Score of the call
NOTE :- Default Sorting is on performed date means the latest task will be shown up.
DownloadThis is simply a button which will download all the details of the reports and will send an email to the associate’s email.
SearchSearching can be done on the Conversation Type , Call Type, Pipelines , Teams , Reps etc..NOTE :- Their will be no search button as searching is happening on change of the input field.
Date FilterTheir is a section above Date Range which shows number of total tasks within the specified date range and filter.
Filtering can be done via date range also.Default selected date will be of today.
Activity Header Card Section ( Based on Type of call )
Inbound Calls :- This will show the number of Inbound calls done by the logged in associate respective to the filter selected.
App Calls or Outbound Calls :- This will show the number of Outbound Calls done by the logged in associate respective to the filter selected.
Click-to-dial Calls :- This will show the number of PSTN-PSTN calls done by the logged in associate respective to the filter selected.
Webinar :- This will show the number of web conference calls done by the logged in associate respective to the filter selected.
This section will contain card per task performed by the logged in associate, this card will contain details for each task like :-
Lead details like name, email and mobile number.
Type of the Call (Inbound or Outbound etc..)
Status of the Call (COMPLETED or INPROGRESS etc..)
Performed Date means the date when Call happens.
Their is a red arrow in the right top in every card which will redirect the user to the conversations page for that task. ​https://salesken.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SALV2/pages/1891434637

Associate can see the details of their own task.
Their is an Activity log pojo defined which has the same schema as the data present in the elastic search which makes easier to map the retrieved data against the pojo.

Their is an activity log dto which is basically used to transfer the data. list of dtos will be returned after taking the data from the activity log pojo and filling the required data to the activity log dto.

FiltersTheir are two APIs , one is for the header card and other is for the activity card which takes all the filters like conversation type , pipeline , stage , rep name , team name , date range , normal search and then elastic search query will be generated on the basis of all the filters which gives the desired result if data is their on ELK.
First one is for Header section This is a GET service which can take multiple Request parameters which will return all the required data retrieving from Elastic Search.
Second one is for Activity CardThis is also a GET service which can take multiple Request parameters which will return all the required data retrieving from Elastic Search.
Third one is for Downloading the reports.This is also a GET service which can take multiple Request parameters

Comparative Analysis :- comparative Analysis page is a report based on the signal coverage comparison between two reps/agents. It shows the coverage in percentage.Coverage :- Ratio of occurrence of signal in percentage in all tasks performed by the reportees of the manager. Formulae - (no. of calls in which the signal was caught / total of calls made by the manager reportees) * 100

Success for a signal :- Lead can have 3 statuses i.e. WON, LOST, INPROGRESS .Example :- Suppose total calls made by all associates under a manager is 100 and out of which 40 calls having lead status as INPROGRESS , 30 calls having lead status as LOST and 30 calls having lead status as WON and out of 30 WON calls let’s say 15 calls are having LEAD QUALIFICATION as a signal so the success percentage for that signal will be (15/30)*100 i.e. 50% which means 50% of the calls with lead status as WON has lead qualification get caught as a signal.

Bar Chart :- A bar chart or bar graph is a chart or graph that presents categorical data with rectangular bars with heights or length proportional to the values that they represent. The bars can be plotted vertically or horizontally. A vertical bar chart is sometimes called a column chart.
Date FilterFiltering can be done via date range only…
Chart Specs :- The chart compares the coverage of signals for every reps and success, with the help of a bar chart. Their will be separate chart per signal.
For the Bar ChartThis is a GET service which can take startDate ,endDate , reps and teams as Request parameters which will return all the required data retrieving from Elastic Search.

Authentication is the process of recognizing a user's identity. It is the mechanism of associating an incoming request with a set of identifying credentials. The identification phase provides a user identity to the security system. The purpose of Authentication is to identify the user’s credentials and to allow login only if the provided credentials are correct. On Successful authentication following things happen:-
Users can log in to the Salesken Platform.
User’s Id is recognized and User Object is fetched from Backend(Redis/Postgres) using Id and saved to the session.
The user is redirected to the manager/associate dashboard based on the role of the user.

Auth0 is a 3rd Party Authentication Service that is a flexible, drop-in solution to add authentication and authorization services to our applications. By Using auth0 we can avoid the cost, time, and risk that come with building our own solution to authenticate and authorize users.
Auth0 provides simple ways to integrate Social Signins, IP/Geo-restrictions,  Brute force attack preventions, Send Welcome Emails, Forgot Password Emails, and many more.

By default, users will not be asked to log in again and will have a persistent cookie stored locally. This will affect all sessions managed by Auth0. Learn more.Inactivity timeout - 4320 mins - 3 daysUsers will be asked to log in again unless they are active within this period (max. 3 days). Read more about this here.Require log in after * - 10080 mins - 7 daysRegardless of the activity, users will be forced to log in after the period (max. 30 days). Read more about this here.

Signal Analysis :- Signal analysis is the summary of all the signals caught during all the tasks performed by all the associates.
Signals :- Signal is the representation of state in a call (or any task) which summarizes the part of that task.

Coverage :- Ratio of occurrence of signal in percentage in all tasks performed by the associate. Formulae - (no. of calls in which the signal was caught / total of calls made by the associate) * 100Instance :- Instance for a signal means total number of call in which that signal get caught.
Semantic Signals :- The meaning of SEMANTIC is of or relating to the meanings of words and phrases
Emotion Signals :- These signals are detected by our Artificial Intelligence engine which has some emotional values.

Correlation :- The correlation page helps us to analyse the relationship between the different signals (semantic and emotion) and also helps us count the instances and coverages of one signal inside the other.
Heat Map :- A heat map (or heatmap) is a data visualization technique that shows magnitude of a phenomenon as colour in two dimensions.
Signal to observe:- The signal which we need to observe in the call like greet, price etc.
Signal to correlate:- The signal which we want to correlate with the signal to observe.
Instance:- Is the number of count of a call  which has a signal to correlate (objection, introduction.. etc) in the total calls(number of call which has signal to observe).
Coverage:- It is in percentage calculated by using  (instance/total number of calls)*100
Example 1If a sales manager A wants to see the tasks of a sales associate B then A must have to subscribe B, then B will be the reporte of A.

Example 2A - managerB - managerC - associateB subscribed C and A subscribed B then B and C are the reportes of A , Now A can see the task of C along with B . Here A didn't subscribed C directly but A can see all the tasks details of C means indirectly C is also reporting to A also along with B.

On-Premises: In an on-premises environment, resources are deployed in-house and within an enterprise’s IT infrastructure. An enterprise is responsible for maintaining the solution and all its related processes.

SaaS: Software as a service (SaaS) allows users to connect to and use cloud-based apps over the Internet. Common examples are email, calendaring and office tools (such as Microsoft Office 365). SaaS provides a complete software solution that you purchase on a pay-as-you-go basis from a cloud service provider.
For the SaaS Deployments, we will be utilizing functionalities of Kubernetes.

Kubernetes is an open-source container orchestration platform designed to automate the deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications. Kubernetes makes it easy to deploy and operate applications in a microservice architecture.
Logging we can manage with the help of Kibana or Cloudwatch.
Kibana is a free and open frontend application that sits on top of the Elastic Stack, providing search and data visualization capabilities for data indexed in Elasticsearch.
Amazon CloudWatch is a monitoring and management service that provides data and actionable insights for AWS, hybrid, and on-premises applications and infrastructure resources.
For Monitoring, we will be using Prometheus with Grafana dashboards.

Prometheus is a monitoring solution for storing time-series data like metrics. Grafana is multi-platform open-source analytics and interactive visualization web application. It provides charts, graphs, and alerts for the web when connected to supported data sources.
1. All System-level Metrics: RAM/CPU Usage, Instance Downtime,
2. Kube-API Metrics: Kubernetes exposed Metrics any Pending Deployment
3. All Internal Application-level Metrics ( if Exposed ).

As we are Moving with Microservices, we will have Docker Images in place with us. These Images have been passed with Multiple Testing Environments such as dev, QA, Production so the error rate will be very less.
We will be utilizing docker swarm for On-premise deployments.

Docker swarm is a container orchestration tool, meaning that it allows the user to manage multiple containers deployed across multiple host machines. One of the key benefits associated with the operation of a docker swarm is the high level of availability offered for applications.
Logging and Monitoring of On-Premise deployments will be based on Customers.

Analysis reflects the insights of a sales call.  Analysis reflects the signals being caught in a conversation be it webinars, telephonic calls or manual uploads by speech transcription of the audio provided, depending on the user’s language preference and eligibility for getting task analyzed. Helps the user to identify the rights and wrongs done in a particular conversation and in turn helping the user to find the best way to approach the lead or to grab the deal.
Signals : Signal is the representation of state in a call (or any task) which summarizes the part of that task.
In Salesken we have two types of signals:

Semantic signals: Semantic signals are predefined words or phrases which are detected by our analysis engine during the task to extract some meaning from the task. These signals are defined by the sales manager during creation of the product.
Emotion signals: These signals are detected by our Artificial Intelligence engine which has some emotional values.
Journey to reflect the post call insights on basis of the organization’s pre-defined architecture.
Catches various aspects of the conversation including quality of the conversation, interest of the lead, etc.

Analysis reflects the signals being caught in a conversation be it an inbound call, outbound call, proxy call, webinars or manual uploads by speech transcription of the audio provided depending on the user’s language preference and eligibility for getting task analyzed or not.
Reflects the talk ratio, agent amplitude, customer amplitude and call duration of the call.
Reflects the analysis score i.e. what is the probability of grabbing the deal or interest shown by the lead towards the deal.

Match method in signal object is set to ‘MILVUS_LSE' or ’MILVUS_USE' depending upon the encoder that semantically matched that snippet and signal.
Invalid or wrong signals are being cleaned from the analysis object returned from the milvus after matching snippets with signals.

Match type is by which speaker(agent/customer/BOTH) should this signal belong to.

If the score of the signal provided by the Milvus * 1.375 is smaller than the threshold for that signal defined in product signal then that signal is removed.
Match Method is MILVUS_USE → score smaller than 0.51 → removed.
Match Method is MILVUS_LSE → score smaller than 0.65 → removed.

A sales pipeline can help you visualize your sales process. It will show you where in the sales funnel all your deals are, where deals are stalling and which sales activities are bringing in the most revenue. It adds a layer of accountability and makes goals easier to achieve by breaking the sales process down into small, trackable tasks.

In other words, Pipeline  is a linear sequence of specialised modules or process. It is the set of user defined stages, for a particular product of an organisation . Every sales associate should follow the stages, which are defined in the mapped pipeline of their team based on the sales cycle. Architecturally pipeline has a few stages and the tasks and leads can be mapped to pipelines. Tasks being mapped to a pipeline (via stage) indicate that the task was performed when the lead was in that stage.Lead being in a certain stage of a pipeline indicate the progress of that lead in the funnel.Functionally pipeline serve 2 purposes for our internal product functioning:
Every sales associate should follow the stages, which are defined in the mapped pipeline of their team based on the sales cycle.
We define what signals to catch in what activities (tasks) via user → team → pipeline → product route.
Pipelines are also crucial in identifying which stage corresponds to a win and lost and become a part of our recipe for lead scoring modules.
There should be an all around mapping from pipeline to product (for product signals) and pipeline with team.
Team/s must be connected to a pipeline → pipeline must be connected to product/s → product must have signals associated with it → product signals should have their generated signals.

We have entered 10 sentences in triggered words then if we pronounce 6 sentence the cue will caught or no?

The cue will get caught if any of the ten sentences are spoken and the speech to text engine detects it with some accuracy and if there is some variation then the neural search engine detects it within a certain threshold.
What is the accuracy of this system and what is the acceptance criteria?
We need to add some examples of audio files and configuration to orchestrate how functionally the system can work. Let’s do it here.
How many characters limitations in name field while creating and editing cues?
how many word limitations in Trigger field while creating and edit cues?

Cues have types which can be Genric/ FAQ etc. Conceptually FAQ is specific to a particular script so its derived from the knowledge base of that specific account/ organization/ product. Whereas Generic cues are pre-configured in SalesKen platform and just need activation. For example something like Banter can be Generic but something like Details of Pricing will be FAQ.
How many cues can be added to product?

Broadly this can be a number as high as possible. The only limitation is that the trigger phrases need to be distant from each other. So if we see them in a grid of sorts they should not be intersecting. Visually like this:
Can we have a product without adding cues?
Yes the system doesn’t stop you from doing that however the expected behavior of cueing engine then will not be working if there is only one product mapped to the user via team-> pipeline.
When we give the numeric numbers in the triggered field what should the customer pronounce?
Out of the box the speech to text engine returns results like so: i have ten thousand rupees in my.
i have ten thousand rupees in my.
So we need to specify in words what we want to be detected. More details on entity validation and constraints here.
If we give the hyper link in content field then are we able to click that link while call is going one?
Yes we support HTML in our cue answers and questions. So things like anchor tags can be added. For example:
If we add a website in the triggered words when costumer pronounce that website will that cue be caught?

So barring special characters as discussed in point 8, another challenge is abbreviation. Out of the box this feature does not work. So I cannot for example say FAO and expect the system to catch it against a configured trigger-word FAO.
Can we able to give accented characters and special characters in trigged words?
No, as discussed above special characters, abbreviations, numbers, accented characters etc are not supported, more details on entity validation and constraints here.
What is result showing in top left is total numbers of cues or total number of trigger words?
So its there on top right like 19 records found is the number of cue cards which have been configured for that particular product.
if we have same trigger word for 2 cues which will be caught?

Currently we are not stopping this from happening so we can configure the same trigger words for 2 cue cards in the product or 2 cue cards in multiple products with the same (similar) trigger words. What this will lead to is the same trigger word triggering multiple cues and they will be shown consecutively. Refer to the diagram in point 7 that is how an ideal trigger word configuration be for the system to operate without surprises.
At a platform level we handle various types of unhygienic or unexpected inputs accidentally supplied by users while interacting with various input areas across multiple interfaces in the product.
We perform backend and front end checks to ensure that such accidental inputs can be handled.

Every entity has a metadata configuration which is basically a JSON object stored in some document based storage which can also be different for different accounts/ organization. The validator factory picks up the metadata definition and validates the input to give a pass/ fail with an appropriate reason. The metadata schema should handle the following scenarios and
A few use cases and scenarios that can be handled are:
SQL Injection: This can be a deliberate attack into our system
HTML injection: This can happen while copy pasting from multimedia links
JNDI Injection: Yet another attack which can attempt to hijack our system
Javascript Injection: To affect the downstream pages that may use the input values affecting their
CSS Injection: Can affect the design of the pages downstream
Empty inputs or just white spaces need to be handled accordingly or can lead to unexpected feedback
Certain fields need to be unique across the tenant/ product like email, name, phone etc
Can affect the downstream page interfaces to look weird or broken
Can also affect CRUD if the datastore has restrictions
Multilingual and multi-script inputs like accented characters, smileys etc.

When a user misses an inbound call and the call goes to voicemail
Daily not being hit SLA 2 hours before the Day ends
When a daily/ weekly signal achievement goal is not met or met

We are building CRM Org level conf adapters in upcoming Integration Sprints. These adapters are made to support any Org specific connector configurations for us to execute the corresponding SK Task onto the corresponding CRM.Dialer at the end of the call/event should be calling a service to trigger the CRM Task. This task should be triggered from scheduler at regular frequency. Scheduler will execute the task from the Integration Service. This Service then pulls DB for the TaskMap via the Salesken task ID.

Post receiving the taskMap for that particular SK Task ID, we want to execute the corresponding CRM for that TaskMap where the task would then be executed/processed. We wanted to generalize task creation irrespective of the Org confs for that Org for that CRM. Hence CRM Connector layer would perform two way communication with the Org Connector and then in the final step, the corresponding task would execute on the CRM. In the last step SaleskenResponse Object is what would need to be returned to the callee. Failed scenarios for CRM failed events must be rerun via some message/events queues to avoid any manual human intervention.Here is the preliminary layout for easy consumption. This HLD decouples Org Connector from communicating with CRM directly. This allows independent project/design for Org Conf/Mappings w.r.t. the actual CRM write/update operation.

CRM is a technology for managing all our customer’s company relationships and interactions with their customers and their potential customers. The goal is simple: Improve business relationships. A CRM system helps companies stay connected to customers, streamline processes, and improve profitability.
When people talk about CRM, they are usually referring to a CRM system, a tool that helps with contact management, sales management, productivity, and more.

A CRM solution helps our customers focus on their organization's relationships with individual people — including customers, service users, colleagues, or suppliers — throughout their lifecycle with their customers, including finding new customers, winning their business, and providing support and additional services throughout the relationship.

While Salesken itself offers a robust out of the box CRM, many of our customers already have a subscription of the many major CRMs available in the market with workflows configured for the same. So, to avoid our customers the friction and pain of changing their workflows, we provide them with the facility to sync data from their existing CRM to Salesken and vice versa. It allows customer the choice to use their CRM while using our/their own dialer while making use of Salesken services. The customer can even mix and match flows according to their liking with the help of our customized sync flows . All of this makes for a hassle free customer experience.
Check if task id exists in database
Check if there is a corresponding user id to the task in the database or salesforce
Check is there is already a corresponding task in CRM created beforehand
The CRM integration resides between the dialer application and the CRM systems employed by our clients
The project is built to sync Salesken systems with other miscellaneous CRM systems
Whenever a task (other entities coming) is created on either one system, they should reflect in the other
It is not a real time system but is rather designed to provide eventual consistency
The goal of the system is to ensure a consistent experience for the agents regardless of whether they use our backend or the CRM of the company’s choice
The Dialer makes an  HTTP GET request to the CRM API with the taskId as a parameter
The controller calls an integration service which gets all details relevant to the task (this includes lead details, sales contact person details and istar user details)

The integration service calls upon a connector provider which returns a connector based on the user id and/or organization id.  A connector basically maps data from our database into the CRM of the particular organization. Currently we use an abstract factory pattern to do this i.e. ConnectorProvider → CRM Connector Factory → Organization Specific CRM Connector
The Connector maps the task details into a JsonObject and posts it to the CRM
Depending on the validity of our own data (no missing fields etc) and the response from CRM, we give a response back to the dialer
We return a beautiful 200 response to the dialer
Task and Lead will be synced to CRM and Salesken
In case it’s a 400 response we return it back to client
If it’s a 500 response caused by the downtime on part of database or CRM, we push it onto Kafka to process till complete
in case of any other failure scenario will return a proper message and code to our service consumer

The subscription and billing module provides functionality to the Sales Manager to purchase subscription plans ie. licenses for their organization, directly from their dashboard according to their need. Likewise, the billing portal in super admin provides admin to administer, purchase, extend subscription plans for particular organizations.
Currently, there are 3 subscription plans, each divided into monthly and annual divisions -
We have integrated a 3rd party library, Chargebee for subscription management that handles recurring billing, invoicing, and life cycle management for the organizations.
Billing and Subscription can be managed from 2 portals namely
ChargeBee is a 3rd party SaaS software that helps integrate and manage billing and subscriptions.
Choose the Billing option from the Configurations Dropdown Menu.
The screen shows total no. of license bought and no. of active licenses. It provides 2 buttons i.e “Upgrade” and “Self Serve”. Both of them are explained below
Upgrade Button - This button takes the user to the screen below.
It contains information about Gold, Silver and Platinum subscription plans. Users can toggle between Annual and Monthly subscription plans. It contains 2 buttons which are :
Cancel Button: If trial period has ended, this button will logout from the application else it goes back to previous page
i. Manager can toggle between Annual and Monthly Plans, each having their      Gold, Silver and Platinum subscription. Managers can purchase only one type of subscription plan.
ii. Manager can purchase Gold, Silver or Platinum plans. They can enter the number of licences (users) they want to buy.
iii. The number of licences  purchased must be greater than their currently active licenses.
iv. Managers cannot degrade their subscription plan. For example, if they currently have the Gold plan, they can’t change it to buy the Silver plan now.
v. Purchase button redirects to chargebee portal for account and card details as shown in below screenshot
Self Serve button -This button redirects to chargebee portal for editing and cancelling account, card and subscription details. Screenshot below
Click on Billing option from the navbar as shown in the screenshot
On clicking Billing option, below screen will appear
i. This screen will show subscription plan name, total license purchased, active license and trial days left ( “trial days left” will be shown only in case of TRIAL plan)
ii. Extend License Button - This button will only be shown for TRIAL plans and when the trial days left is 0 (zero). It will extend the trial period only for 7 days.
iii. Mark Payment to Paid button - This button will only be shown when the payment status of the license for that organization is false. It will mark the payment status as true for that organization.
iv. Self Serve Button - This button will be shown for non-trial subscription plans. This button redirects to the chargebee portal for editing and cancelling account, card and subscription details.

v. Upgrade Button - This button will redirect to the following page. It contains subscription details and the admin can purchase a license for the organization. It is similar to the subscription page in the manager portal.  It consists of a Purchase button, where admin can purchase any amount of license but it must be greater than their active license.
Manager portal has a page called Call Barging which actually is made for the manager so that Managers can listen, whisper or barge into live conversations happening on SalesKen.

Barge: Barging means that the manager can join the ongoing call as a conference participant. Both the parties (sales rep and the customer) can hear what the manager is saying  and the manager can hear what both of them are saying.

Listen: Listening means that the manager can either join the conference as a muted participant or just stream the ongoing call to their browser so that the manager can just listen to the ongoing conversation but not be able to say anything.
Whisper: Whispering means that the manager can join the ongoing call as a conference participant but only the sales rep can hear what the manager is saying.

Barging and Whispering can only work if the call is a conference call , so for the purpose of Barging/ Whispering the call must be a conference call and this should be configured at a user level and the associate should have initiated a conference call not a normal call.
If the call is being streamed through the SalesKen’s real time Cueing API then just Listening will be enabled , barging is not coming in the picture .

Basically  making a conference is something which is to be implemented in calls by adding participant into that ongoing call. If the call which is initiated is a conference call then adding a participant to that ongoing call means the call is now taking place between the Manager, an Associate and the Lead . So when we will make a conference call there is something called room name which is regenerated , this room name will help us to add a participant in that call . At first room generated will be empty that means at the initial point only  Associate will be present in that room .After that adding of participant will be started .
The  Call Barging page gives the information  of the ongoing call of the Associates who are subscribed under him.
In this page the details  which are represented under him are
Start time (from what time the cl is being started )
These information is provided to the Manager for the understanding that which Associate is on the  ongoing call with which lead and from when.
Features which are present in his page are
This highlighted feature is called Barging . Barging means that the manager can join the ongoing call as a conference participant.

This is one of the added feature in the Call_Barging page , in this  feature if the Manager clicks on the Barge button then he will be able to join the  ongoing call which is taking place between the Associate and the Lead. As the  start time is already provided  in the UI then he  will be able to see the details and can analyze about the time from what time the call is started .
When the  Barge button is being clicked the Manager will also join the ongoing call as a  conference participant and now the  call is  taking  place between  the Manager, Associate and the Lead.

For the Call Barging feature which is there for the Manager is only possible if the call is a conference call .If the call is not a conference call then this feature will not work .  This should be configured at a user level and the associate should have initiated a conference call not a normal call.

This highlighted feature is known as Listen .  Listening means that the manager can either join the ongoing call  as a muted conference  participant or just stream the ongoing call to their browser so that the manager can just listen to the ongoing conversation but not be able to say anything.

For the Listening  feature which is there for the Call_Barging page , is possible when the ongoing call which is taking place between the Associate and the Lead should be a conference call and the Manger will join the call as a  muted conference participant but not be able to say anything.
This Listening  feature can also be implemented by real time APIs in that only listening will be enabled. API implementation should be done for this feature .

This highlighted feature is known as Whisper. This feature will allow the Manager to interact but only with the Sales_Associate .  Manager wants to speak anything between the call , he can speak but the conversation will be only between the Manager and the Associate , customer will not be involved in this . Customer cannot hear manager.

For the Call Whispering  feature which is there for the Manager is only possible if the call is a conference call .If the call is not a conference call then this feature will not work .  This should be configured at a user level and the associate should have initiated a conference call not a normal call.

All the systems need to have a standard Uniform User object. As the User Object is a very critical part of our every system, this restructures must have a low latency caching User object architecture.

The approach is to make a standard API for user management and call this API when we need to perform any user management operations. These APIs will fetch/update/create data from/in DB/REDIS using this standard User Object.

After Authentication to any system, an access token is generated which is stored in the user session and it’s used during these API calls. All the APIs should have an Authorization header with a bearer token. The Bearer token stores userId as the subject, role as claims, and expiry date of the token format: refer ​https://salesken.atlassian.net/l/c/MWDzqdup .

Background: The calls are placed using aircall and the activities (called engagements in hubspot) are created by aircall. Our use case is primarily around post call analytics for this customer.

Now in order to pull the calls we will be polling hubspot and fetching the engagements and mappings to the right CRM entity like contact/ account/ deal etc by using the mappings in Hubspot CRM. We will be using Aircall’s call detail API to fetch the recordings to our system. This job will run daily.

Post in general:Post successfully adding a new team member, that user can act as Sales Associate or Sales Manager persona on Salesken Webapp. This then exposes the user to start using calling functionality, generating call reporting functionality etc Teams are the basic structure to manage Sales Pipeline for our customers (Organizations). Accidental delete operation on a team would automatically soft delete all the users within that team. Post successful purposeful delete operation disables any dialer calling for all the users from that affected team. Same is the outcome if a given team member is deleted from any specific team.

Delete team and team members is an extremely high impact activity for any Organization. An appropriate backend restore backend operation would need to be performed if there was any accidental deletion.

Micro-service based backend API application that Live streams any internet call over VOIP  of any dialer through Salesken CRM(Appie) App  to Cueing engine.
Call must be an Internet call over VOIP. Does not support proxy or PSTN calls
User who initiate the call must have a valid VOIP number/caller Id to make the call
Inbound server (APPIE) and outbound server (Cueing Server) must be up and running for successful Stream processing.
This service will sit  between the VOIP calling APP and Cueing engine. It will have no UI and will only talk through APIs
Call is initiated from APP which calls Streaming server API to connect call and start live streaming to Cueing Engine.

The Open Source Telephony Recording and Retrieval System. The project currently supports recording voice from VoIP SIP, Cisco Skinny (aka SCCP), raw RTP and audio sound device and runs on multiple operating systems and database systems. It can record audio from most PBX and telephony systems such as BroadWorks, Metaswitch, Asterisk, FreeSwitch, OpenSIPS, Avaya, Nortel, Mitel, Siemens, Cisco Call Manager etc.
The Oreka system consists of a combination of the following services
OrkAudio: this is the audio capture background service. It supports VoIP, TDM and Sound Device based recording.
OrkTrack: this service centrally tracks activity on the entire system and logs recordings to any popular SQL database.
OrkWeb: this service is the web interface accessible via any standard compliant web browser. It relies on the Tomcat web server.
OrkRfb: this is the screen capture background service. It relies on the RFB protocol used in VNC.
This will take care of call management and its full life cycle.
Real-time media streaming over an RTMP endpoint that can be played using any player supporting the RTMP stream.
The feature would be available on-demand and can be enabled/disabled using an HTTP API.
It can be enabled/disabled based on the SIP-Call UUID.
Each call would have a unique RTMP URL while streaming, which would be provided in the enable/disable HTTP call.
There would be no transcoding done by the streaming service, and the receiver would have to transcode if any.

Orkaudio provides a Filter Interface. A Filter is a black box that takes media chunks as input and produces media chunks as output. It can be translating between two encodings (codec) or just procession the signal. Implementation for Filter can be written and plugged in via Orkaudio's configuration file.

LiveStreamFilter is an implementation of Orkaudio's Filter Interface. It captures the incoming audio chunks, processes them to stereo stream chunks, and ingests them to an RTMP server. For every live call, an object of LiveStreamFilter is instantiated. The RTMP server then exposes a unique RTMP URL [rtmp://:/live/] for each call that can be used to live-stream audio on any RTMP-supported player.
used oreka live RTMP stream to feed into ASR (deepgram).(A component in Cueing engine)

At right end of the name last activity time period is shown and below that number of SMS are unread are shown as a notification.

Sent SMS are shown at right in box below it and received SMS are shown at left of the box.

At below there is attachment button at left to send attachments and chat box is present. At right side of the box send button is present to send the SMS written. Send button will be disabled if you want to send SMS to outside US number.
Lead list is shown as per latest SMS sent. Show leads which have been sms'd upon recently followed by recently created leads.
If a file is attached then an MMS is sent

When the send button is clicked a task  is created of type SALES_SMS_TASK with direction as outbound and call_status pooled. The id of the SMS provided by Twilio should be stored in call_sid field of the task.
This task is mapped against the contact person and lead which was selected from the Lead List to whom the SMS/ MMS is to be sent
Twilio is being used as the primary SMS/MMS provider
Once the SMS/MMS is sent to the user, a statusCallBack link will be hit, to update the call_status of the task from pooled to delivered.
The SMS will be analyzed also and showed it on the report of the user.
On the click of a SMS type task the SMS page is opened with q={phone_number} which will be respected by the page when it loads so that the right history is opened.
The CRM hook will also be called and SMS type activity gets logged in Salesforce, Zoho, LeadSquared accordingly.

User can send and receive SMS only if the number is a Twilio phone number. SMS/MMS can be sent only to US phone number and cannot be send to outside US number. We should do this check on the page load and if this check fails then we need to show an error message saying that the phone number mapped as caller id to the user cannot be used to send SMS and a new number should be provisioned from user management for this user to send SMS/MMS.
Whenever a SMS is received on any Twilio number provisioned from the application then the webhook will be hit.
The webhook does 2 things : Identify the user and identify the lead.
If we fail to do user identification then an event is logged for the support/ superadmin to monitor and understand.
If we fail to do lead identification then just a notification of type SMS received is sent to the user identified.
If the user and the lead is  identified:
uniquely then the SMS is forwarded to the user mobile sending a link onto clicking which the chat is opened directly and mention in the message that it's just a FYI message and must not be replied.
Also a task of type  SALES_SMS_TASK with direction as inbound and call_status pooled. The id of the SMS provided by Twilio  should be stored in call_sid field of the task.
When the forwarded SMS is received by the user then the call_status is updated to delivered.
While creating task we sent this data to our DB-
Entity:name : Name  (Name of the Lead)
description : message body/text (SMS/MMS sent to lead)
actor: user ID  (User ID of the associate given by Twilio)
start_date: Created At (Time when the first SMS/MMS sent/received)
end_date: Updated At (Time when the last SMS/MMS sent or received)
task_type : 'SALES_SMS_TASK' ( It shows that task created is of the type SMS/MMS)
lead_id: leadID ( Assigned ID of the lead )
sales_contact_id: Lead ID (Phone number of the lead)
call_sid: MessageSID ( foreign key received from twilio)
Tags : Shows unread / Read status ( It shows if the message received is read by associate or not)
Telephone_provider: ‘TWILIO’  (Telephone provider from where we are interacting with lead)

This section gives a scope description and overview of everything included in this SRS document. Also the purpose, for this document is described and a list of new features and definitions are provided.
The purpose of this document is to present a detailed description of version 2.0.4. It will explain the purpose and features of the 2.0.4.
Auth0 : Auth0 is used for user authentication and authorization in v2.0.4

Audit logs : The Audit Logs are added in v2.0.4 for associates. It is the representations of the logs of User CRUD operations, where the associates can check only the changes done by them for their own profile.

SMS with Media functionality : The SMS are added in v2.0.4 for the associates. The SMS functionality enables an associate to connect to a lead through text  based media. The media can also be shared over the chat.

Multiple Language Support : The purpose of the multiple language support feature is that, the user will be able to use accented characters for setting up their username i.e. foreign names will be supported.

Default calling by Plivo : When a new user is created for any organization in Super Admin the default calling service assigned to the user is Plivo. The advantage of assigning Plivo is that there is no caller id verification required and the user’s contact number will be shown as from number during the call.

Comparative Analysis Report : The Comparative Analysis Report is added in v2.0.4 for associate. Comparative Analysis Report shows the graphical representation of the signals which are analyzed from a call recording. The associate can compare his data with any other associate present in his team.
Hubspot Integration: This feature is used to integrate hubspot CRM for organization.

Billing module - The subscription and billing module provides functionality to Sales Manager to purchase subscription plans ie. licenses for their organization, directly from their dashboard according to their need. Likewise, the billing portal in super admin provides admin to administer, purchase, extend subscription plans for particular organizations. Currently, There are 3 subscription plans, each divided into monthly and annual divisions -i. Silverii. Goldiii. Platinum
